loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

loans.name: Maria Helen

texts.en:
Maria Helen is 45 years old and lives in Catulayan, San Juan, Siquijor.  She has had a live-in partner for eight years and they have been blessed with two children. 

Maria Helen sells clothing to earn a living.  Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase ready-to-wear products.

Maria Helen has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Maria Helen hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear products.

loans.name: Ceralyn

texts.en: Ceralyn, a 27-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has been raising pigs to earn a living for the past three years. A member of PMPC for three years, Ceralyn is requesting a loan to purchase piglets and feeds for hog-raising.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds for hog-raising.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn, a 64-year-old married woman living in the Philippines, has been raising pigs to earn a living for the past 15 years. A new member of HSPFI, Marlyn is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feeds for the pigs. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, a 47-year-old resident of Pasay City, Philippines, who is married to Alfredo, a mechanic, and mother to her children. She, with the assistance of her family, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elena is a mineral water distributor, purchasing mineral water in containers from wholesalers, and then selling them per container (5 gallons per container) for a profit. She earns additional income by selling personal products such as Avon, Natasha and other direct-sales products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan to bU. more stocks of mineral water and other personal merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Elena dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of mineral water and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marionito

texts.en:
Marionito is a married man with two children. Marionito is 39 years old and resides at Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Marionito owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn to earn a living. He has been 16 years in this business. Each month, he earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

Marionito has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Marionito wants to expand his farm land and to see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Edgardo has a pigpen and sells mature pigs. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Edgardo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edgardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for his  pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulk grains, instant products, cold cuts, sweets and drinks.

loans.name: Elyenita

texts.en:
Elyenita is a married woman with six children. She is 39 years old and resides at Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Elyenita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been three years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase products to resell. 

Elyenita is been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Elyenita wants to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Luís Enrique

texts.es: Luís Enrique de treinta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos. El posee una venta de productos plásticos, últimamente han subido sus ventas pues es muy conocido en la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha mas clientela, Luís vende productos de muy buena calidad a precios accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable; él es un hombre emprendedor le gusta mantenerse activo en el trabajo y aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presentan pues solo así podrá alcanzar el éxito, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar isopos, sillas, vasos entre otros. Luís Enrique tiene la esperanza de que su trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luís Enrique is 36 and lives with his life partner and their three children. He sells plastic products and lately his sales have increased since he is very well known in the area and has attracted many more customers. Luís sells very high quality items at accessible prices and his service is unequaled. 

He is an enterprising man who likes to stay active working and take advantage of every opportunity that presents itself because only in this way can he achieve success. He has requested a loan from INTEGRAL that would enable him to purchase swabs, chairs and glasses among other products. Luís Enrique hopes that his work will allow him to give his family economic security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy swabs, chairs, drinking glasses and bottles.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married with six children. She is fifty  years old and lives in Mahayag, Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur.

She has a business  to earn a living and  has had this business since she got married. Each month, she earns 4,100 PHP doing this business. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

In the future, Lourdes hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Marcelinda

texts.en:
Marcelina is 56 years old and lives in Catulayan, San Juan, Siquijor.  She is married with five children.

Marcelina engages in selling fresh fish in the market to earn a living.  She earns PHP 3,000 a month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy fresh fish to sell in the market.

Marcelina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Marcelina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cough syrup, pills, vials, powdered whey and vitamins.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is from Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 57 years old. Leonarda is married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Leonarda owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonarda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Leonarda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Leonarda is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery goods to sell . She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: José Martir

texts.es:
El señor José Mártir, tiene  51 años de edad, es casado, tiene más de veinte años de residir en el Barrio  El Way del municipio de Intibucá.
Tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos están estudiando en secundaria y dos ya cursaron sus estudios secundarios.
Se dedica al comercio desde hace veinte años, vendiendo ropa nueva (pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos de niña, cobijas, suéteres, ropa interior y calzado), su esposa se dedica a oficios domésticos y le ayuda en la administración de su negocio. 
Él ha solicitado un financiamiento por la cantidad de L. 12,000.00  el que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería y aprovechar las ventas de la temporada de graduaciones en los colegios. 
Su negocio es muy estable y está ubicado en el mercado municipal de Intibucá, tiene buena experiencia en esta área comercial. El espera brindarles la educación a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
José Mártir, 51, is married and has been living in the El Wey neighborhood in Intibucá Township for over twenty years.  He has four children; two of them are in secondary school and two have completed secondary education.

He has been a merchant for twenty years selling new clothes (pants, shirts, blouses, girls’ dresses, blankets, sweaters, underwear and footwear).  His wife does housework and helps him run his business.

He has asked for a L12,000 loan to buy more merchandise to take advantage of sales during school graduation season.  His business is very stable and is located in the Intibucá municipal market.  He hopes to provide his children with an education so that they will become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive con sus hijos en una localidad muy concurrida de personas. Ella posee una venta de productos de uso personal, es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre vende productos de primera calidad a excelentes precios; Yolanda es una mujer muy activa y le encanta su trabajo, le gusta mantenerse adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que el hombre tiene el secreto del éxito en sus manos si pone esfuerzo y constancia en su trabajo, solo así lograra el triunfo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, perfumes, cosméticos, shampoo, entre otros. Yolanda tiene fe que este esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda is forty-five years old and living with her children in a busy town full of people.  She has a business selling personal products.  Yolanda is well known in the area and has made a lot of customers, because she always sells quality products at great prices.  

Yolanda is a very active woman and loves her job.  She likes to stay ahead of the competition.  She thinks that one has the secret to success in their hands if they put in effort and perseverance in their work; this is the only way to triumph.  This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that allows her to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics, shampoo, among other things. Yolanda has faith that this effort will allow her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics, and shampoo.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is from Calabayan in Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old. Edna is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
An industrious farmer, Alfredo is a father of three children. All of them are now adults and have their own families. Right now, he is cultivating his corn farm to improve their poor living. At his age, he also feels pain in his body when he works a lot but seeing his family depending on him gives him more strength to work harder. 

Now, Alfredo is asking for the loan amount of P25,000 to buy corn (bio-seed), fertilizers and pay for the laborers that help him plant corn in his farm. He would like to monitor carefully his crops in order to get a higher net income for the coming harvesting time. He hopes for the success of his farming in order to have a comfortable lifestyle as well as to help lift his family from the poverty line.

loans.use: to buy corn (bio-seed), fertilizers and pay for laborers that help him plant corn.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando was very young at the age of 21 to cultivate a farm but he chose the “field” rather than school. He sacrifices his future because of his siblings especially his father who is always tired in promoting their standard of living. So the young man decided to help his father. 

The fact is, he is asking  for the loan amount of P25,000 to buy two bags of corn seeds and six bags of  fertilizers to be used in their farming business. This is a great financial assistance for their corn field, so he assures to monitor and give all the needed inputs of his crops in order to have a capacity to harvest more next season.

loans.use: to buy two bags of corn seeds and six bags of  fertilizers.

loans.name: Limy

texts.en:
Limy is from Ozamiz City outside of Manabay, Philippines. She is a 35-year-old married mother of three school-aged children. She is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community, and she has been in business for over three years, earning about 5,000 PHP a month.

Limy joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting her fourth loan, for 17,500 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. She hopes to earn additional revenue so she can improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Amado is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Amado has rice fields that produce rice that he sells in grains per kilogram or sack during harvest time. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

Amado has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Amado hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 45 years old, an industrious farmer in his community. Their corn field is their primary source of income and that is why Jimmy cares a lot about his farm. He is asking for the loan amount of P25,000 as additional capital to buy agricultural inputs such as corn seeds and fertilizers.

He wants to send all his four children to school and see them finish their desired courses, thus he works so hard in farming without doubt, despite the tiredness he always experience. If his toil goes toward the education of his children, he will always be happy doing it. 

He hopes he could be able to harvest more crops to be able to increase his income and to save more funds for the schooling of his children. With his unending tiredness and hard work, he expects to yield an abundant crop in the coming harvesting season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as corn seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Aladino

texts.en:
Aladino is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married.
 
Aladino has a rice field that grows rice that he sells as rice grains per kilogram or sack during harvest time. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

Aladino has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Aladino hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en:
Myrna is 48 years old and married with 11 adult children. She is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

Myrna joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy seedlings and fertilizer such as manure. Myrna will use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedling and fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El Señor Santiago, tiene  47 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene dos hijos (26 y 28 años) reside en la comunidad rural de Jardines en el Municipio de Taulabe, departamento de Comayagua.

Su actividad económica es la agricultura, específicamente a la producción de viveros de café para la venta en plantía.

Don Santiago ha solicitado su primer préstamo de L.10, 000.00 para la compra de bolsas para vivero y fertilizantes. 

Considera que es un buen negocio ya que sus clientes cada año le demandan mayores cantidades de plantas, sintiéndose motivado a seguir con esta actividad ya que le deja buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Santiago, 47, lives in a common law relationship with his wife and has two children (26 and 28 years old).  He lives in the rural community of Jardines in Taulabe Township, Comayagua Department.  His economic activity is farming, especially coffee nurseries to sell for planting.

Santiago is asking for his first, L10,000, loan to buy bags for the nursery and fertilizer.  He believes that this is a good business because his customers ask for larger numbers of plants each year which motivates him to continue with this activity because it leaves him with good profits.

loans.use: to buy bags and fertrilizer for his nursery.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
This is Jaime, 35, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. He is married to Mirela, an employee and mother to their four children. Jaime, together with his wife and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support his children’s schooling. 

Jaime  buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it with a little profit. His products are footwear, sandals and other products of the sort. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling price and the many options he offers. His regular customers are the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, Jaime is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of sandals and slippers to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Jaime hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his children will be able to finish their studies and graduate one day. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional footwear products needed for his business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old and married, with 11 adult children. She is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Evelyn plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

Evelyn joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Evelyn will use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Genalyn has a vulcanizing shop that provides air pressure in tires, tire repair and other vehicle repairs.  Her husband is the repairman. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy materials needed for the vulcanizing shop.

Genalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Genalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a widow with two children. She is 63 years old, and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. 

Consolacion owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting banana products to earn a living. She's been in the business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Constancia has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Consolacion wants to expand her land and save for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Maria Lady

texts.en:
Maria Lady is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Maria Lady has a bakeshop that sells breads, cakes, cookies and pastries. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients used in making breads and pastries.

Maria Lady has been a member of HSPFI since 1997. In the future, Maria Lady hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used in making breads and pastries

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 

Alberta has a retail shop that sells rice by the kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of rice to sell.

Alberta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Alberta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Fredelito

texts.en:
Fredelito is an industrious farmer. At the age of 48, he has been in this business for 10 years. This occupation provided by our Lord to him was laborious and difficult, but he was persistent in growing it. He is asking  for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizer and corn seeds and to pay for people who will work in his corn field. He wants to grow his crops well so that he can reap much in the upcoming harvest season.

Fredelito has five children to support so he needed to work harder to yield enough crops for his family. Hopefully, through his perseverance and patience, he will be able to lift his family from a poor standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn seeds and to pay for people who will work in his corn field

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
This is Renelyn, 31, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Maximino, a mason. They have three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Renelyn operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell those items with a little profit. Her products are pants, cargo shorts and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of pants to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Renelyn dreams of growing her business in the coming years and also of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities and varieties of pants to expand her inventory

loans.name: Dura

texts.en:
Dura is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.
 
Dura has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Dura is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Dura hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Merlyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and gasoline by the liter. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and gasoline to sell.

Merlyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and gasoline to sell

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора добрая отзывчивая женщина. Она замужем имеет троих детей. Для содержания семьи она помогает мужу и на протяжении трех лет занимается продажей сухофруктов. На полученные доходы они завершили строительство дома. Она хочет получить займ  в размере 4000 сомни для оптового закупа сухофруктов Она надеется получить займ и закупить товар, также расширить свой бизнес и получить больше доходов.
texts.en: Gulnora is a kind and responsive woman.  She is married and has three children.  In order to support the family, Gulnora helps her husband and has been involved in selling dried fruits for three years.  They used their received earnings to complete the construction of their house.  Gulnora wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 4000 somoni for the wholesale purchase of dried fruits.  She hopes to get this loan and buy the products, and also expand her business and earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits wholesale

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 56 years old, a mother of three adult children. She is helping her husband operate their corn field business. This is their source of income, so they need to keep production improving in order to get much in the next cropping season. Norma needs to acquire additional capital to finance their field's farm inputs. 

Norma is asking for a loan of PHP20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Through this, their farming will be maintained.  With determination and perseverance, she hopes to reap enough crops to pay the loan as well as to continue to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a married woman with four children. Rachel is 38 years old, residing in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental: Philippines.

Rachel owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of different products to earn a living. She has 6 years of experience in this business. Each month, she earns approximately 6,840 PHP from her business.

She requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to re-sell. Rachel has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Rachel wants to expand her business and to help her children complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to re-sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Alicia has a food shop (cafeteria), where she sells and serves snacks and coffee . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy additional snacks, beverages and coffee to re-sell to her customers.

Alicia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Alicia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional snacks, beverages and coffee

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, a 35-year-old resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Ellias, a driver. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Helen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a packet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She generates profits by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail prices. Aside from this she also sells cooked food in her store. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Helen hopes her business will grow into a mini-grocery store and dreams to be able to provide her children with a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. That is also where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase various grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Andy

texts.en:
To make a living, 37-year-old Andy has owned and operated a small corn field in his village. He has been in this business for two years. With this business he is able to support his family: a wife and three children. He does not want his family to experience any difficulties of life.

He is hoping to improve his family's standard of living. As a result, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides that will be used on his corn field. He is hoping to grow his crops in order to harvest them during the harvesting season. His net income from the crops will be saved for the education of his children as well as to provide for his family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides that will be used on his corn field

loans.name: Obidajon

texts.ru: Обидаджон замужем. Муж инженер-строитель. У них четверо детей. Они стараются для детей создать все необходимые условия. Она 6 лет занимается переработкой и продажей сухофруктов. На местном рынке она продает сухофрукты. От полученной прибыли они провели свадьбу своего сына. Закупив оптом товар она хочет получить больше дохода. Для этого запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони и надеется на вашу доброту. Спасибо!
texts.en: Obidajon is married.  Her husband is a construction engineer, and they have four children.  They try to provide all of the necessary conditions for their children.  Obidajon has been involved in processing and selling dried fruits.  She sells dried fruits at the local markets.  Obidajon and her husband used their profits to hold a wedding for their son.  She wants to buy products wholesale and make a large profit.  This is why she is requesting a loan in the sum of 5000 somoni and relies on your kindness.  Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase products wholesale

loans.name: Dashzeveg

texts.en:
Dashzeveg is 38 years old and lives with his wife and four kids in a Mongolian ger in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is an enterpruener and his kids are school students.

He started his dairy products selling business in 1990 with just one cow. Now he owns seven cows and makes various kinds of products. Because his business has been doing so well, he can hardly meet the demands of his customers. As a result, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 MNT to buy two more cows.

He explains that he is a strong and diligent man who will do everything he can in order to educate his children because he does not want them to grow up as he did.

loans.use: To purchase two additional cows

loans.name: Davaanyam

texts.en:
Davaanyam is 25 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her husband is a clerk in the local market. 

She started her garment retailing business by renting a counter in a local market. Her products are very stylish and handpicked, and  therefore she has many regular customers. 

Now that her products are selling well, she needs to expand her supply in order to run her business successfully. She is a young and hardworking woman who says, "I have a baby coming, Every time I think about it, it makes me work even harder."

She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kunduz's Group

texts.en:
Kunduz is the leader of this group. She is 38, and together with her husband, she is bringing up two sons, both of whom study at school. 

In order to earn money, the family cultivates agricultural products and sells them on the market. They started this activity ten years ago with an initial investment of 6,000 KGS. At the moment her monthly profit is about 3,000 KGS. 

With the money received from the loan, Kunduz wants to purchase a ton of apples for resale. In the future, with the profits gained from the trade, she wishes to open her own grocery store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase apples.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 52 years old and blessed with three children. 

He is a diligent farmer who sends his children to school through his farming income. Through perseverance, he is able to provide the educational needs of his children. However, most of the time, they lack allowances. He would not want this to affect their studies, so he also focuses his attention on improving his agricultural activity.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. He hopes this will help him to get better crops in the coming harvesting season. With farming and his determination, Reynaldo is expecting to continue to send his children to school and to college.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard, her elder son helps in her business, her middle son is a college student and the youngest one is a school student. 

She started her grocery trading business in 2007 by renting a counter in market. Now her product range has been extended and her income has increased. However, due to her son's college fee, she hasn't got sufficient funds to run the business. 

She is a sharp and diligent woman who says, "I will do everything I can to get my children educated." 

She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more candy and seasoning to resell.

loans.use: To buy candy and seasoning.

loans.name: Thao's Group

texts.en:
Thao was born in 1960. She lives in Tuan Le village. She has two children (a daughter and a son). They have monthly income. 

Thao has a general store. She and her husband work there. They sell groceries (candy, cakes, cigarettes, sugar and many other goods). They have had this job for five years. They have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

This is the second time she is borrowing money from SEDA. The last time she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy more groceries to sell with the purpose of earning more profit.

About other borrower in her group:
Tam is 29 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy a camera for her shop.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур женат имеет двоих детей. Он трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Более 18 лет Баходур занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. В основном он выращивают овощи. Баходур также занимается виноградоводством и скотоводством. Он хочет улучшить свое жилищное условия и с этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 1500 Сомони. Он хочет использовать займ для закрытия кровля своего дома и покупки стройматериалов и рейки.
texts.en: Bahodur is married with two children. He is a hard-working and good-natured man. For more than 18 years, Bahodur has grown crops, mainly vegetables. Bahodur is also engaged in grape growing and raising cattle. He wants to improve his housing conditions and is asking for a loan of 1500 Somoni ($325). He wants to use the loan to close the roof of his house and for the purchase of construction materials and lumber.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials and lumber

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has been a farmer in their village for four years. Within these years of operating his corn field, he has already experienced a year in which he earned nothing from his hard work because of a disastrous calamity. But this causes him to become stronger. 

He is very thankful to have Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. to help him by approving his requested loan of PHP 20,000 to buy corn seeds and fertilizers and pay for the labor cost that will be spent in planting. This will be serving as his starting line to begin his new journey as a farmer.

He needs to become stronger to face the trials that a farmer will encounter during his struggle for success. His wife and four children are depending on him, so he needed to be more industrious.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers and pay for the labor cost.

loans.name: Karypjan's Group

texts.en:
Karypjan is the leader of this group. She is a resident of a small village called Bokonbaevo, which is located in the Isykul region in the northeast part of Kyrgyzstan. She is 50 and married to a farmer. 

Five years ago, with an initial investment of 3,000 KGS, the family started to breed livestock. They started this business because of the need for funds to meet the family’s daily needs. By reselling livestock after fattening, Karypjan earns about 5,000 KGS per month. 

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase hay to feed the livestock during the winter season. In the future she wishes to see her son  wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay.

loans.name: Ganzul

texts.en:
Ganzul is 28 years old and lives with her mother in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her mother is retired. 

She started her hairdressing business in 2005 by renting a space in a hair saloon. She is well experienced and she is known for her flawless work. 

Now that her equipment is getting old, she needs to buy new equipment for her customers' satisfaction. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I enjoy my work and I am good at it. However, my customers demand is getting high," 

She is requesting 600,000 MNT to replace her equipment.

loans.use: To replace her equipment.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: На центральном рынке города Наргис занимается купле- продажей женских и мужских обувей. Она незамужняя 24 летняя девушка. Она активная, целеустремленная и добросовестная девушка. Её бизнес требует сезонные обновления и ей надо приобрести зимние обуви для своих клиентов. Наргис старается привозить хорошие высококачественные обуви для того чтобы её клиенты были довольны и приходили еще. Она планирует расширить свой бизнес и увеличить ассортимент товара. Наргис хотела бы получить займ для осуществления своих планов и заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Nargis buys and sells men's and women's shoes on the central market of her town. She is 24 years old and not married. She is active, purposeful and honest young woman. Her business demands seasonal renewal of inventory and she needs to buy winter shoes for her customers. Nargis tries to bring in good high quality shoes so that her customers will be satisfied and return again. She plans to expand her business and increase the assortment of merchandise. Nargis wants to get a loan to realize her plans and is thanking everyone in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of merchandise.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children.
 
Milagros has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Milagros has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Uruila's Group

texts.en:
Uruila is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married to a tractor driver. Together with her husband, she is bringing up a son and a daughter. The daughter studies at school and the son helps his dad. He drives the tractor too.  

Uruila is a retiree. She is applying for the loan because they need funds to purchase a wheel for the tractor. This tractor is the main source of income for the family. In the future, Uruila wishes to repair the house and to celebrate her son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a wheel for their tractor.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 31 years old and is married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, she has run a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, shampoo, and detergents. Adelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Adelina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, shampoo, and detergents. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo, and detergents

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en:
An is 42 years old and is lives in in Phu Man village, Cho Town, with her husband and two children. For the past five years, she has run a general store where she sells things for the people in her village such as cake, candy, cigarettes, sugar, wine, beer and many other goods. An earns a monthly income of 6,000,000 VND.

An is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy merchandise to sell with the goal of expanding her business and increasing her profit. This will be her first loan with SEDA.

Hue is the other borrower in this group. She is 45 years old and is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Criste

texts.en:
Criste is 25 years old and is single with one child. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, Criste has run a shop where she makes and sells woven bamboo, or amakan. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

Criste is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy materials she needs for her weaving. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to weave bamboo

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Avelita is 58 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Eastern Looc. To earn a living, she runs a business where she sells fruit and she earns about 15,000 PHP each month. Avelita has been a member of PMPC for four years.

Avelita is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Davlatali

texts.ru: Давлатали занимается купле- продажей хозяйственных товаров. Более 15 лет он постепенно за годами расширяет свой бизнес и успешен в своем деле. Он начал данный бизнес с малого товарооборота, а теперь имеет широкий ассортимент товаров. Он продает посуду, такие как чайник, пиала, ведро, кастрюли, плитки и т.д. Он продает свой товар по низкой цене, чем у конкурентов. Из-за этого он имеет много клиентов и ему необходимо пополнить место проданного товара. Давлатали хотел бы получить займ для покупки товара для пополнения товарооборота и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Davlatali buys and sells household goods. He has been gradually expanding his business for more than fifteen years and is successful in it. He started his business with a small commodity turnover and now has a wide range of goods. He sells kitchen appliances such as teapots, teacups, buckets, pots, tiles and more. He sells his merchandise at lower prices than his competitors. He has many customers because of this and he needs to restock what he has already sold. Davlatali wants to get a loan to buy merchandise to increase commodity turnaround and grow his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is 58 years old and married with five children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, Ignacia has run shop where she sells fruits like mangoes and bananas. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

Ignacia is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan to buy fruit to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for her food items

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is married with five children. Pacita is 57 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Pacita sells a variety of snacks. She has operated this business for five years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients.

Pacita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Pacita hopes to generate more savings for her family.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, milk and other ingredients

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is 19 years old and lives in Usocan, Plaridel. She is married with no children.

To earn a living, Claire has a fish-selling business. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Claire has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Claire has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Claire would like to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Rosanna is peddling & selling a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy dried fish to sell.
Rosanna has been a  member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Rosanna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, age 37, is a married and has three children. he  resides in Dimalco, Bonifacio Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

George owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting a variety of crops to sell to earn a living. He has  been 5 years in this business. Each month he earns 10,000 PHP from this business. 

George has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. George has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, George wants to build his own house and help his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Bebita

texts.en:
Bebita, age 43, is married with 5 children. She lives in the Philippines.
Bebita is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years.She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. Bebita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Bebita hopes to see children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en:
Edmar, 25 years old, is engaged in farming. He has been in this business for 4 years. He needed to work in this field because he is the only one of his siblings who could work. Nevertheless, he accepted it wholeheartedly because it helps a lot towards finishing his vocational education.

Edmar is asking for a loan amount of 15,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to be use in his corn field. He wants to improve his production for the betterment of their lifestyle. His parents and siblings are depending on Edmar  to have better income.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Cherrylen

texts.en:
Cherrylen is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Cherrylen has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Cherrylen is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cherrylen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mary Anne

texts.en: Mary Anne, a 30-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Caipilan, Siquijor where she has been operating a sari-sari store for the past two years, earning a monthly average of PHP 10,000.00.  A member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for ten months, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase more stock for her store. In the future, Mary Anne would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.ru: Зулхумор мать троих детей, замужем. Она любит свою семью и старается  улучшить благосостояние. Она занимается откормом скота. От продажи скота имеет большие доходы. Она старается создать все условия для дома. Она хочет получить займ  для достройки веранды, штукатурки, проведения отопительной системы и ремонта двух комнат в размере 9400 сомони. Она надеется получить займ и заранее благодарна вам.
texts.en: Zulkhumor is a mother of three children, she is married. She loves her family and tries to improve their well-being. She feeds cattle and has a big profit from selling the cattle. She tries to create good conditions for the home. Zulkhumor wants to get a loan in the amount of 9400 somoni to build a porch, put plaster, install heating equipment and repair two rooms. She hopes to get the loan and is thanking everyone in advance.

loans.use: to build a porch, put plaster, install heating equipment and repair two rooms

loans.name: Abdyrahman's Group

texts.en:
Abdyrahman is a member of this group. He is 58 and, together with his wife, they raise two daughters. Their older daughter studies at school while their second daughter is pre-school age (under seven). His wife works in the department of water resources.

In order to earn money to provide for his family, Abdyrahman breeds livestock and re-sells them after fattening. Abdyrahman earns approximately 2,000 KGS per month from this business. He started his livestock-breeding business ten years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS. At the moment he is applying for this loan because he needs additional funds to purchase more sheep for breeding. In the future he plans to open a big farm. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase additional sheep

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 27 years old.  She is single and the mother of three children.  Her family lives in the Philippines. 

Rita has run a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish, for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more dried fish to sell.

In the future, Rita hopes to improve her business.  Rita is a new member of HSPFI.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a very industrious mother who helps her husband operate their corn field business.  

She is 47 years old and has three school-age children.  Due to financial difficulty, she is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.  Rosemarie hopes that they will get better crop production during the next harvesting season so they can afford to pay for the schooling of their children.

Rosemarie is hoping that disastrous typhoons will not enter her country again, especially in her area so she can avoid farm income losses. 

She hopes that through her patience and hard work, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.  Rosemarie would also like to see her children graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with four children. 

Consuelo has a pigpen that sells matured and grown pigs.  She has been in business for five years.  Consuelo requests a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Consuelo has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Consuelo hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Ruth sells ready to wear clothes.  She has been in business for five years.  She requests a loan of 50,000 to purchase additional ready to wear clothes to sell.

In the future, Ruth hopes to see her children finish college.  Ruth has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready to wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne has operated her clothing business in Nakuru town for the last nine months.  She is 34 years old, married to James and they have three school going children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of its field officers and this will be her first loan.  Anne plans to use the loan to buy more clothes for sell.

In future, Anne hopes to expand her business to import and export cloths and become one the leading clothes dealers in Nakuru.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has operated her clothing sales business in Naivasha town for the last 40 years.  She is 61 years old, married to Benard and they have eight  children.  She also has houses for rent and is a farmer.

She was introduced to KADET by one of its field officers and this will be her first loan.  Susan plans to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

In future, Susan hopes to expand her business and get more income, to buy plots to construct more rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 56 years old livestock keeper.  He is married to Rael who is a farmer.  They are blessed with two children aged 20 and 18, respectively. 

He has raised and sold livestock for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of about KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

Joseph is applying for his first loan from Kiva, via KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Joseph will use the loan to buy a heifer and animal feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he plans to buy goats.  

His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to the university level and to open a retail shop which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber, nails and seat fabric for his workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Norgel

texts.en:
Norgel is 33 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor.  She is a single mother of three children.

To earn a living, Norgel runs a food stall business.  She has had this business for 16 years.  She earns about PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock for her business.

Norgel has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months.  In the future, Norgel hopes to expand her business and to be able to save the income for the future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her food stall

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin is a 31-year-old entrepreneur from Kakamega County, Western Kenya. He is married to Christina and they have four children.  

Calvin operates a cereal business in Kakamega town and has been doing this for the last eight years.  He makes a monthly income of KES 10,550. He is taking his first loan which he will use to buy additional stock of cereal to sell.

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business because he hopes to have the best and biggest cereal shop in Kakamega town. His desire is to be able to meet his family’s expenses like food, clothing and shelter.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of cereal to sell.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Annalyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Annalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Annalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: Мунаввар много лет занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и откормом скота. Она любящая мать и жена. Она вместе с мужем и со своим сыном работают на земле. Труд приносит хорошие доходы. Они выращивают  пшеницу, ячмень и лук. Отходами вскармливают скот. Она хочет получить займ в размере 10000 сомони для покупки скота и зерновых. Она надеется на получение займа и заранее благодарна вам.
texts.en: Munavvar has been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up livestock for many years.  She is a loving mother and wife.  Munavvar, her husband and son work on the land.  This work brings in a good income.  They grow wheat, barley and onions, and use the crop residue to feed the livestock.  Munavvar wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10 000 somoni for the purchase livestock and cereal crops.  She hopes to get this loan and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock and cereal crops

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette, age 33, owns and operates a beauty salon that provides manicures, pedicures, haircuts, and hair styling. She has had this business for 10 years. She and her husband have four children.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 4,000 in order to buy materials needed for the beauty parlor.

Janette is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Janette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo, age 47, is engaged in a farming business. For the past year of operating his farm, he has been able to master essential methodologies and to continue learning new adaptations to keep pace with modernization in the agricultural sector. However, his crops were destroyed by storms resulting from the unexpected typhoon that entered the province where he lives.
 
For this reason, he is asking for a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. With these inputs, he can improve his business. His goal is to lift his family out of poverty and improve their standard of living. Moreover, he is determined to provide sufficient financial support for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty, age 42, has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She and her husband have three children.

She requested a loan for PhP 5,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 
 
Letty is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Letty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad, age 40, has a retail shop that sells coconut wines, beverages, and food seasonings. She has had this business for five years. She and her husband have four children.

She has requested a loan for PhP 4,000 in order to buy coconut wine, beverages, and food seasonings to offer for sale.

Trinidad is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Trinidad hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine, beverages, and food seasonings to offer for sale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, age 23, is a food vendor. She has run a food stall in Yei, South Sudan, for three years. She is unmarried and has no children.
 
Alice has requested a loan through BRAC, South Sudan, in order to purchase tomatoes and cooking oil to offer for sale. With her extra income expected from this loan, she hopes eventually to build a commercial house.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and cooking oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Gregory Wayne

texts.en:
Gregory Wayne is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Gregory Wayne has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gregory Wayne is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gregory Wayne hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Gafur

texts.ru: Гафур 11 лет занимается  откормом скота. У него большая семья он отец троих детей и заботливый муж. Он старается создать хорошие условия для семьи. В настоящее время он имеет 5 голов крупного рогатого скота. Он хочет получить займ в размере 5000 сомони для приобретения дополнительного скота и корма для них. Он уверен, что вы его поддержите и он получит займ. Он заранее благодарен вам в поддержке.
texts.en: Gafur has been involved in fattening up livestock for 11 years.  He has a large family, is a father of three children and is a caring husband.  He tries to provide all of the necessary conditions for his family.  Currently, he has five heads of cattle.  Gafur wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 5000 somoni to purchase additional livestock and fodder.  He is certain that you will support him and that he will get this loan.  He thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fodder

loans.name: Mischeal

texts.en:
Mischeal is a married woman with one child. She is 27 years old and resides in Buracan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. 

Mischeal owns and operates a business venture, cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000. 

She has requested a loan of 8,000 to pay for the cost paid for coconut harvesting. Mischeal has been a member of GDMPC for almost three years. In the future, she wants to expand the business and for her child's education to be completed.

loans.use: to pay for the cost paid for coconut harvesting

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, salt and baking powder to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Gloria has a retail shop that sells homemade sausage called longganisa, chorizo and dressed chicken. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

Gloria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Mbuzi Tukorrehamu Group

texts.en:
John owns and operates a retail shop. He is a hard-working young man who has been running this business for five years. John faces a primary challenge in people taking a long time to clear their debts. His business goal is eventually to own a large wholesale shop. 

John lives with his wife and three children in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and to construct a high-quality, permanent house. 
 
John needs the loan to buy salt, sugar, and soap to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, and soap to offer for sale

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Corazon has a tailoring shop that makes curtains, pillow cases, and gowns, and repairs clothes and uniforms. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop. Corazon is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Corazon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Celirena

texts.en:
Celirena, age 47, cultivates fruit trees to earn a living. She harvests the fruit from her trees and offers them for sale. She has been 18 years in this business. Each month, she earns PhP 5,000 from her business. 

Celirena and her husband have three children and live in Buracan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.

She has requested a loan of PhP 8,000 to pay for the costs involved in coconut harvesting. Celirena is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Celirena wants to expand her business and to support her children's educational costs.

loans.use: to pay for the costs involved in coconut harvesting

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina, age 31, has a grocery store business in Yei, South Sudan. She has operated her business for four years. Her husband has his own business and they have no children.
 
Selina has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase sorghum, maize, and beans to offer for sale. She plans to save the extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase sorghum, maize, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Emma Group

texts.en:
Emma, age 50, has been a rice farmer for the past 10 years. She has requested a loan of PhP 23,900 to purchase fertilizer for her rice plants. Emma has been a member of PMPC for four years. She and her husband live with their four children in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Emma is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each of the two members has her own business.

In the future, Emma hopes to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza, age 43, owns a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. Maria Liza and her husband have six children.
  
Maria Liza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Maria Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 63 and widowed, is a pig breeder. She has been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns PhP 2,500. She has requested a loan amounting to PhP 10,000 to purchase feed and medicines for her piggery business. Teresita has raised four children and lives in Ibabao, Siquijor, Siquijor. 

Teresita has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 10 months. In the future, Teresita hopes use the profits from her business to add to her savings deposit.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines for her piggery business

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry, age 31, owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. He has been five years in this business. Each month, he earns PhP 8,000 from his work. He and his wife have three children.
 
He has requested a loan of PhP 10,000 in order to purchase additional products to sell in his shop. Henry is been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Henry wants to expand their business and to support the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in his shop

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is 57 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. Nelly has a glassware business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional materials for glass shelves and cabinets. Nelly has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Nelly hopes to expand her business in nearby localities.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for glass shelves and cabinets.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, age 22, is a hard-working man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He lives in a semi-permanent house with five of his family members. He is currently operating a motorcycle business, a venture he started three years ago, before which he was working for other people. He faces a challenge in the rainy season, during which the roads are slippery. 

Christopher's business dream is to acquire more motorcycles. Christopher needs the loan in order to buy a motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transportation business

loans.name: Eufrocina

texts.en:
Eufrocina, age 34 and unmarried, has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.

Eufrocina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Eufrocina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina, age 24, has been working hard for the past five years to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar and soap. She lives with her husband and three children in the town of Rukoki in the Fort portal region of Uganda. Two of her children are enrolled in school and one is still young. 
 
To help expand her business, Josefina has requested a loan in the ampount of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and soap to offer for sale, and will help Josefina to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Josefina hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Josefina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Josefina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to offer for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 39-year-old married woman but has no children. She has had a business of selling food items in Yei, South Sudan, for nine years. 

Florence requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase soda, salt, and sugar for sale. She says that she will use her extra income from this loan to build a department store for her business extension in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soda, salt, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is 33 years old. She lives in Phu Man village. She is married and has one child who is going to school. 

She not only grows rice but also sells hats in the market. She has this job for five years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). 

She has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more hats to resell.

loans.use: to buy more hats to resell.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
This is Irine, 38, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband Luisito is a miner. Irine is mother to two children, both of whom are already studying in elementary school. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Irine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Philippine Peso's (PHP)-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Irine hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
