Deo is 38 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Deo has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Deo has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cooking oil for resale, and will help Deo to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Deo hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Deo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Deo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна замужем. Ее супруга зовут Петр.  У них двое детей. Татьяна имеет свой бизнес.Она имеет свою торговую точку на центральном рынке города. Продает Татьяна твердый сыр, масло подсолнечное, масло сливочное , маргарин и колбасу. На рост бизнеса повлияло качество продукции и хорошая цена. Татьяна обладает нужными качествами: она трудолюбивая, целеустремленная, открытая и искренняя. Она ставит для себя цели улучшать благосостоянии семьи.
Татьяна просит предоставить ей кредит на сумму 10,000 гривен на закупку товара: масла и сыра.
texts.en: Tatyana is married.  She and her husband Peter have two children.  Tatyana has her own business.  She has a retail outlet at the town's central market.  Tatyana sells hard cheese, sunflower oil, butter, margarine and sausage.  Quality of products and good prices positively affected the growth of her business.  Tatyana possesses the necessary qualities: she is a hardworking, goal-oriented, open and honest person.  She sets goals for herself of improving her family's livelihood.  Tatyana is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia for the purchase of products, such as butter and cheese.

loans.use: to purchase products, such as butter and cheese

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 30 years of age and a farmer in his community. He has been operating this business for a year and it really helps him more to support his family. Because of the disastrous typhoon occurring in their province, his expected production in his crops was not attained--many of his crops were destroyed. For this reason he is in need of additional working capital to renew his corn field. This is also to recover the costs spent and provide for his child and wife. 

Right now, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers. These inputs would have a great positive effect on the development of his farming, which will allow Jonathan to provide sufficient financial support for the studies of his child and for the family's daily basic needs at home.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar is 29 years old and married. He lives in the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. Though they don't have siblings, still he works hard to sustain their daily needs and improve the business of his wife. Farming is primarily the main source of family income.

Jomar has been farming his cornfield for over eight years and he has been managing about four hectares. With his determination to improve his cornfield, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 27,000. This amount would really help his farming business to be more productive because he will be using his requested loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides and certified seed. He hopes that he could make his dream come true, which is to maintain his cornfield and make it more productive. In this way, his profit will increase, which will help him improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, certified seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Neulex

texts.en:
Neulex is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Neulex has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Neulex has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy spare parts for resale, and will help Neulex to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Neulex hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business. 

Neulex is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Neulex who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale,

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is an industrious and optimistic person. He is a farmer in their community, tilling a small parcel of land for farming that is their main source of income. He dedicates himself to his farm activities to improve his family’s status of living. Johnny is 43 years old now, married and blessed with three children. His loving wife also helps him in their business to lessen the burden on his part and save more expenses for labor cost. They hardily work together to increase their yields for the future of their children. 

Due to financial constraint, he is asking for a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for the labor costs required for planting corn. After all, he knows that this is for the sake of their business success. He hopes for further development of their cornfield through those inputs he will acquire through the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor costs required for planting corn.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 35 year old and married with six children. Five of them are in school. She has a business selling food in Yei, South Sudan for five years. Esther requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer, soda, and brewing alcohol to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beer, soda and brewing alcohol for sale.

loans.name: 020901-Hoằng Đông -Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyết has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food to sell.

Tuyết is 54 years old and she is married with five children.

She is the leader of a three-member group, the 01 Hoằng Đông solidarity group.
 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with five dependents.

In 2005, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tuyết has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Tuyết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food to sell

loans.name: Nelya

texts.en:
Nelya is married with a grown daughter. She used to work at the Pavlograd mechanical factory. However, her salary was held back most of the time while the work itself was very hard. Therefore, Nelya resigned and launched her small enterprise in the central city market. Today she is an entrepreneur who sells a variety of retail items. Nelya owns three vending locations and sells plastic bags, napkins, tissues, toilet paper, etc. Nelya has been in this business for 12 years. She is an experienced market vendor who has gained loyal clientele. 

Nelya is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase additional plastic bags in bulk for further retail sale in her kiosks. This business is the main source of income for Nelya's family. It sustains Nelya's family as well as her daughter and granddaughter who currently live with her.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bags, tissues, and other inventories in bulk.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 2 years, Scovia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and soap to sell, and will help Scovia to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Scovia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Scovia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 45 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.   Eden has a shop where she sells canned goods, noodles, biscuits and other items. She has had this business for two years.

Eden is asking for a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos to buy more inventory for her shop, including canned goods, noodles, and biscuits.  She has been a member of Kiva field partner PMPC for four years.  In the future, Eden hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits and other items as inventory for a small shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old and married with seven children. Four of them are in school. She has a business selling in a grocery store in Yei, South Sudan for six years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase simsim, groundnuts, and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase simsim (sesame), groundnuts, and onions to sell

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and is married with six children aged between 5 and 14 years old. She takes care of seven children. Rose owns a business selling cows. This is her fourth successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 6 am until 4 pm every day except on Sunday. She currently employs one person to help her.

Rose has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her animal sales business. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 56 years old and lives in Ibabao Aloran,Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.
 
Letecia has a sari-sari store business and earns approximately PHP 400 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store.
 
Letecia has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Veronica Group

texts.en:
Veronica is married with 10 children. Veronica is 52 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Veronica is a farmer and produces corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 32 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers for the maintenance of her corn production.
 
She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Veronica hopes to be successful in her business.

Veronica is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 36 years old and is married with five children between 2 and 16 years old. She takes care of six children. Epiphanie owns a business selling various goods such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, salt, lotions, soap etc. 

This is her 6 successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 5:30 am until 8:30 pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her.

Epiphanie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase the various goods she sells such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, salt, bread, biscuits, lotions, soap etc. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, she will reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, rice, sugar, salt etc to sell.

loans.name: 03.09.105.thiệu Dương Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lộc works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Lộc is 60 years old and married with four children.

Lộc is the group leader of the 03.09.105.Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of six members.
 
She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lộc has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Lộc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lộc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lộc hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to buy land of her own, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 45 years old and lives in Upper Loboc, Oroquieta City. She is married with five children.
 
Wilma has a sari-sari (variety) store business and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Wilma has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Wilma hopes to have a lot of capital because she wants to earn money in order to build a shop. Wilma is a good mother and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
At 38 years old, Marcelo manages a small farm in his village. He finished elementary grade then ended up in farming. He needs to patiently till his farm in order to provide for his big family. He needs to ask for assistance from Kiva, requesting a loan amount of 25,000 Philippines pesos (P) to buy corn, fertilizers and insecticides to apply to his corn field.

These inputs will greatly affect his farming for the better. His income from farming will be saved for the education of his children as well as for the improvement of his business production.

loans.use: to buy corn, fertilizers and insecticides used in his corn field.

loans.name: 03.11.106.thiệu Ngọc Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy has a retail business, selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase processed seafood to resell.

Thủy is 38 years old and she is married with three children.

Thủy is the group leader of the 03.11.106. Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, and has three dependents.

In 2010, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thủy  faces in her business is the distance to the city center.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to buy land of her own, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase processed seafood to resell.

loans.name: Royal Group

texts.en:
Shamira, who is in her early 30s, is married with one child. She has had a beauty salon business for one year now. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use it for buying more salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to have an internal salon.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Royal," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Cherlie

texts.en:
Cherlie is 31 years old and lives in Bolibol, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children.
 
Cherlie has a firewood business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase materials for the construction.
 
Cherlie has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the construction

loans.name: 03.11.107.thiệu Ngọc Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hiền is 37 years old and she is married with three children.

Hiền is the group leader of the 03.11.107. Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of five members.
 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province, and has three dependents.

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to buy a new motorbike, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Bich

texts.en: Bich is 46 years old. She lives in Phu Man village. She has two children. Not only does she grow rice, but she also buys scraps to resell. She has had this job for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid it punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy scraps to resell with the purpose of earning more profit.

loans.use: to buy scraps to resell

loans.name: 03.11.108.thiệu Ngọc Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Diện N. works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Diện is 31 years old and she is married with 2 children. Diện is the group leader of the 03.11.108.Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

This is Diện's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Diện has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main harship that Diện faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Diện hopes to remodel her house. She hopes for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.en:
Maria Cecilia is married with one child. She is 21 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Maria Cecilia sells a variety of snacks and barbecue to earn a living and has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase pork for barbecue, plus flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients for snacks vending.

Maria Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for 9 months.

loans.use: to purchase pork for barbecue, plus flour, sugar, and milk for snacks vending

location.town: Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 37 years old and is married with four children, aged between 5 and 15 years. Alphonsine owns a business selling various goods, such as cosmetics, biscuits, and drinks. She has 3 years in this business and the hours of her work are from 6 am until 9 pm everyday. She currently employs one person to help her.

Alphonsine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase various goods, such as cosmetics, biscuits, drinks, and cooking oil to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future, reinvest in her business, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase various goods, such as cosmetics, biscuits, and drinks to sell.

loans.name: 03.07.109.thiệu Long Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lâm works in agriculture by farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to grow vegetables and trees.

Lâm is 53 years old and she is married with 4 children. Lâm is the group leader of the 03.07.109.Thiệu Long solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Lâm's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Lâm faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lâm hopes to buy her own land. She hopes for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to grow vegetables and trees.

loans.name: 03.07.110. Thiệu Long Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Huệ is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.
Mrs Huệ works in agriculture dealing with farm food. Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Huệ faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle feed. This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Huệ hopes to buy land of her own, for her business to do well, and to provide for her kids.
Huệ is the group leader of the 03.07.110.Thiệu Long solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed

loans.name: Perpetue

texts.en:
Perpetue is 38 years old and married with three children between 5 and 14 years old. Perpetue owns a business selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for one year and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 6 pm every day except on Sunday. 

Perpetue has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save in her future and she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with seven children. Susan is 49 years old and lives in Catadman, Ozamiz City.

Susan sells cartons to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase cartons for her business.

Susan has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Susan hopes to expand her business buying and selling cartons.

loans.use: To purchase cartons for her business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
This is Mercy, 28, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Romy, a driver, and she is a mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this, she also does manicures and pedicures for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mercy hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen is 40 years old. She lives in Phu Man village. Not only does she grow rice, but she also buys leaves to resell for a restaurant (leaves are used to make cake). She has had this job for 5 years. She has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time, she borrowed 8,736,000 Vietnam dong (VND). This is the sixth time Yen is borrowing money from SEDA. This time, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy leaves to resell. When she earns more profit, she will buy furniture.

loans.use: to buy leaves to resell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a responsible wife who helps her husband in managing their corn field business to support their needs. Due to financial difficulties in financing their business, the 30-year-old woman is now asking for a loan amount of P25,000 to buy corn seeds and insecticides for farming. Profits will be used to pay for hired labourers.

Despite the fact that it is difficult to work in the field, she wanted to save for the educational purposes of her two children, so instead of hiring one or two helpers on their farm, she saved the money for their school allowances. This caused her to help her husband to improve their sources of income. In this regard, Analyn is aiming to increase their yields in the coming harvesting season. 

In the future, she is hoping that her children will become degree holders and will be of big help to lift up their poor lifestyle into something better.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and insecticides for farming

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 40-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for three years.
Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal for sale. She says that she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 57 years old and lives in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 10 children. 

Rosita works in the fishing industry and sells/catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 33 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat. Rosita has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Maria Fe Emily

texts.en:
Maria Fe Emily is 41 years old and lives in Molicay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Maria Fe Emily has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 every month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.
 
She has been a member of PMPC for about four years. In the future, Maria Fe Emily hopes to be successful in her business dealings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last six years. She is 44 years old, married to Kindi and they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She paid all her previous loan well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to plant maize and wheat under irrigation in her farm and on large scale.

In future, Maria hopes to have a large plantation of wheat as well as pump water for irrigation into her farm, thereby becoming one of the leading farmers in the region.

loans.use: To plant maize and wheat under irrigation

loans.name: Mwinyi Group

texts.en:
Yusufu, who is in his mid-30s, is married with two children who go to school.  He has been a tailor for 10 years now.  He works from 7 am to 7 pm daily and makes a good monthly profit.

This will be his 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy fabrics, to open a shop for selling fabrics and to pay household expenses. He has paid back his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy more fabrics for the fabric shop.  His dream is to one day be able to buy a pickup for delivering fabric..

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mwinyi", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for his fabric shop.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men is 52 years old. She lives in Phu Man village, Cho town, Bac Ninh city. She has three children who are still small. Not only does she grow rice but she also buys and sells rice. She has had this job for five years. She has a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the fifth time she borrowed money from SEDA. This time, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more rice.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 30 years old, single, and operates a farming business in his village. He lives simply with his parents. Everyday, he goes in the field, where he spends most of his time of the day. He was already trained in this type of work, so even though he works in the field for the whole day, it is nothing to him. The important matter is, he is providing for the needs of his parents.

As of now, he is asking for a loan amount of P25,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, which will be used towards the growth of his corn field. He hopes that by this season, he can get better crop production to save for his parents' needs, especially since they are getting older. He is also preparing for his own future. Arman wants that his future family will be secure, so he is doing the best that he can.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides used in his corn field

loans.name: Rachel Group

texts.en:
Rachel is married with three children. Rachel is 37 years old and lives in Molicay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rachel sells snacks like polvoron, bread, and bananacue to earn a living and has had this business for almost five years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Rachel is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Rachel hopes to be successful in her business so that she could continually support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Hanybal

texts.en:
Hanybal lives simply in his community with his wife and child. He is an industrious husband; he has managed his farming business for more than six years. This is their primary source of income. Through his hard work and patience to work everyday in his business, he knows that there is hope for him to achieve better living in the future.

He is a 38-year-old man, asking for a loan amount of P20,000 to buy corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers. These will be used in his corn field to generate better yields by the next cropping season. He hopes to gain much produce to sufficiently provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro is 44 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 

To earn a living, Ma. Socorro has a business selling soft drinks. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Ma. Socorro has requested a loan of PHP 10,500 to purchase beverages to sell.

Ma. Socorro has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Ma. Socorro would like to pay school tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beverages to sell

loans.name: Kenzhekan

texts.ru: Кенжекан 37 лет, замужем и имеет четырех детей, старшая дочь замужем, остальные - школьники . Ее муж Алтынбек  работает строителем, а в свободное время помогает Кенжекан по бизнесу. В 2001 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Кенжекан начала заниматься торговлей женской одеждой на местном рынке. Хороший ассортимент товара Кенжекан, приветливое обслуживание, практичные советы при подборе одежды привлекают  все больше и больше клиенток. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кенжекан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров за счет закупа женской одежды осенне-зимнего периода.   Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на ремонт своей квартиры.
texts.en: Kenzhekan is 37 years old, married and has four children.  Her oldest daughter is married, and the rest of the children are in school.  Her husband Altynbek is a construction worker and helps Kenzhekan with the business in his spare time.  In search of finding an additional source of income, Kenzhekan became involved in selling women's clothing at the local market in 2001.  Her wide assortment of merchandise, friendly service, practical advise with clothing selection attract more and more clients.  In order to further grow her business, Kenzhekan requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her merchandise assortment by buying women's autumn and winter clothing.  She plans to use the profits from this loan to make repairs to her apartment.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Nasantogtokh

texts.en:
Mr. Nasantogtokh, 45, is a photographer. He has been running his business since 1997 and prefers to develop his own business step by step. He lives with his 3 children and wife in the slum district of Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Photography is the main income source of this family. Because only Nasantogtokh is employed in this family, he pays for one of his son's college tuition fees. 

Now he wants to renew his camera and some photography equipment. It is a big and important step towards his business improving, and he thinks that his earning will be increased after the renovation of work tools. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of new photography equipment.

loans.use: to cover the cost of new photography equipment

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 25 years old. He is a business gentleman who sells various items in his boutique such as cooking oil, salt, rice, sugar and lotions. He has spent six years in this business. He is single, and has requested the loan to buy more items for resale in his boutique. He hopes to make a renovation of his house from the profits he will get in his business.

loans.use: To buy more home products for sale

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old, single and lives with four family members, two of whom work.

Salman is a tailor. In 2009 he decided to open his own workshop for making, repairing, or altering clothing such as suits, coats and trousers for women and men. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of the needs of local customers. He has a good reputation and is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2800 in order to pay the annual rent and to make display cases. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to make display cases.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen is 69 years old. She lives in Nguyet Cau village, Yen Phong district, Bac Ninh. She has four children. They are all married. Mrs Sen has a general store. She sells groceries. She has had this job for ten years. She has a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8.288.000 VND and repaid the loan punctually. This is the 5th time she is borrowing money from SEDA. This time, she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to expand her store (buy more groceries like candy, cakes, sugar, beer)

loans.use: to expand her store (buy more groceries like candy, cakes, sugar, beer)

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta, age 44, is married with three children.  She lives in the Philippines.

Marietta is a farmer and she also raises pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for eight years.  Marietta requests a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase coconut fruit. 

Marietta has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, Marietta hopes that profits from her business will help her provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase coconut fruit.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 22 years old and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City.  She is married with one children. 

Annabelle has a sari-sari (general, convenience) store business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more stock to sell in her store. 

Annabelle has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Badnaanyambuu

texts.en:
Badnaanyambuu is a 28 year old computer programmer and web designer.  He started his business in 2009 and already has some permanent clients. 

He lives with his wife in the house of his parents.  But recently he bought a house and a small lot in Mandal Soum, a northern town of Mongolia.

To get moved out from his parents house he is taking a loan to help cover the cost of his new house.

loans.use: to help cover the cost of his new house.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is married with two children, ages three to six years old.  Both attend school. 

Alphonsine, age 28, sells a variety of products in her store, such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, lotions and spices. 

She has requested a loan to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products in her store, such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, lotions and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is married with three children. She is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Luna is a farmer who grows assorted vegetables to earn a living.  She has been doing this for eight years.  Luna has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase five sacks of fertilizer.
 
Luna has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdel Mahdi

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has two children.

Abdel Mahdi is a carpenter; he has owned a workshop since 2006, building bedrooms, kitchens and repairing old furniture. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of the needs of local consumers and is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for this loan of $2000 in order to purchase a spiral saw. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a spiral saw.

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is 39 years old.  She sells sugar, rice, salt, cooking oil and scholastic materials such as books and pens. 

She is married with seven children who go to school.  

With this loan she plans to buy adding merchandise to sell.  Monique plans to use the profits to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Monique dreams to have a big store

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and lives with nine family members, seven of whom work.

Karar is a carpenter. In 2008 he started a workshop, building bedrooms, kitchens and repairing old furniture. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of the needs of local consumers and is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for this loan of $2400 in order to purchase a carpentry machine. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry machine.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 36 years old.  She is a widow with one child who is 14 years old. 

She sells green bananas and has been in business for more than 12 years.  Christine has requested this loan to buy more bananas to sell. 

With the profits from this business she will pay school fees for her child and provide food for her family. 

Christine would like to be become a more prosperous businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut is 59 years old.  She lives in Nguyet Cau village, Yen Phong district, Bac Ninh city.  She has four children.

Ut sells dry goods like beans, salt, sugar, chilli, garlic and more to many people in her village.  She has been in business for ten years and earns a monthly income of about 6.000.000 VND. 

She has borrowing money from SEDA since 2008.  This will be her fifth loan from SEDA.  Her last loan of 8.288.000 VND was repaid punctually. 

This time she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to buy goods for her store.

loans.use: to buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Marciliana

texts.en:
This is Marciliana, 44, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines.  She is married and mother to three children.  She and her husband manage their household while operating a variety business.  She works hard to provide income to meet their everyday expenses.

Their variety store is a small convenience store, that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to neighbors.   It is, for example, the place to buy shampoo, cooking oil or an egg.  She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling retail.

Her store is located adjacent to her house.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her store.  Marciliana expects a boost in her business income as she expands. 

Marciliana hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good, high quality education through all of her hard work.  

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-------------------------------------------------------------

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Toktobubu's Group

texts.en:
Toktobubu, 64, is the leader of this group.  With her husband, who is a retiree, she has raised six children - two sons and four daughters. All the children are married, employed and live separately with their own families. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 6000 soms, Toktobubu purchased a calf for breeding. Since then, the couple has been breeding farm animals. Toktobubu also sells dairy products, through which she earns about 2000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase sheep for breeding, fattening and reselling.  In the future with the profits gained from this activity she plans to improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 40 years old and owns a butcher shop where she sells meat.  She has been in this business for more than seven years. Jeanne has requested this loan to buy cows for slaughtering. With the profits, she plans to pay school fees for the children, and provide food for the family. She dreams of seeing her business grow, so she can have her own butcher house in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cows to provide meat.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo's greatest dream in life, is for his family to have a better quality of life. He works hard to be able to attain it. He believes that sending his children to school, so they may pursue their degrees, is the best opportunity that he can give his children.

Leonardo is 29 years of age, married and blessed with two children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines. His wife is a housekeeper. They work and help each other to reach his dream. Leonardo engages in a hog raising business, which is his family's source of income. Leonardo wants to maintain his business because he believes that it will help him attain his dream and wishes. He is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Janylkan

texts.en:
Janylkan is the resident of Tup, a small village in Isykul region. She is 53 and unfortunately she is a widow. This brave woman has raised six sons and a daughter.  Three older sons are married; they live and work in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). The other three sons help Janylkan with housework and her daughter, studies at school.  In order to earn a livelihood, Janylkan sells clothes at the market. She started this business seventeen years ago with an initial investment of 3000 soms.  Currently, her business runs well and she earns about 8000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she will purchase winter clothes in order to improve and increase the variety of goods that she sells.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes for resale

loans.name: Fabienne

texts.en: Fabienne is 35 years old; she has 4 children aged between 3 and 11. She is married to a businessman who helps her in her business. She owns a restaurant and has requested the loan to buy more ingredients, to make food for her customers. With the profits, she plans to save and pay school fees for her children. She would like to be a distributor for the customers who work far from her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to cook food at her restaurant.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
This is Josefa, 48, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Elpidio, a driver, and a father to her four children.  With the help of her husband, she manages her household while operating the business.  She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josefa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be usimg the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Josefa hopes that with hard work, her business grows in the coming years and she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.   She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other inventory for her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 23 year old, a widow, and has one child who is not in school.  She has had a business of selling fish in Yei, south Sudan, for three years.
Mary requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase fish.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is 44 years old and lives in West Point.  She discontinued her education in 11th grade.   She is single and has two children 16 and 20 years old.  For the past three years she been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in her community.  She liked the community's response to her business, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper and meat for her restaurant.  Her future plan is to buy a piece of land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper and meat for her business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 42 years old and he has a pair of twins aged 5 who go to school. Jean sells clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. He has requested the loan to buy more clothes for sale.   He expects to use the profits from the business towards savings and to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
This is Domingo, 54, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Agustina, an overseas contract worker and mother to their only child.  Domingo,  manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support his child’s schooling. 

Domingo operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Domingo hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his child will be able to graduate one day, and finish their studies. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other inventory for the store.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 54 years old, married, and has four children. Among her children, only one is still in school, and is pursuing a college level of education. 

Julieta is engaged in a hog raising business while her husband runs their rice farming business in their village. Julieta is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy additional piglets to raise. She wants to maintain and develop her business for the future of her family. 

She depends on the business she manages for the education of her child. She will manage her business well to further support her child’s needs in pursuing her degree.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 24 years old, married, and has one child not yet in school. She has had a business of selling tea in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Doris requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar, tea leaves, and glasses for easy operation of the business. She says that she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea leaves, and glasses.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 45, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Retolimer, a photographer. She is the mother of four children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josephine operates a photo and video coverage business. She and her husband offer photo and video coverage for any occasions like weddings, birthdays, and any special events that require their services. Her regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in their business every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional accessories and other materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Josephine hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for accessories, parts, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en: Sophie, aged 42, is married and has two children who are 11 and 13 years old. She owns a boutique which sells different products such as maize flour, cassava flour, rice, cooking oil, and sugar. She has spent 8 years selling different items in her store. She wants a loan to add more merchandise for sale. She expects to get the profits from this business to save for her future business growth.

loans.use: To buy more flour for sale

loans.name: Angeli

texts.en:
This is Angeli, 29, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband Ricky is a baker. She is the mother of only child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover their everyday expenses.

Angeli operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this, she also operates a bakery alomg with her store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Angeli hopes her business grows so she can add another branch. She also hopes to give her child a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap and slippers for her  business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is married and has three children. She is 49 years of age and runs a hog raising business. Daisy is inspired with her belief that nothing happens unless first we dream. Daisy dreams of uplifting their living standards to give the best quality of life to her family.  With the guidance of her dream, Daisy works hard to obtain it. She engages in managing a hog raising business as her way to help her husband carry their family out of poverty. Daisy wants to maintain her business and further take care of her family needs. 

She needs additional working capital to work out her business. Thus, she is requesting a loan of Php 25,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a hardworking businessman.  He is 36 years old. He is married and blessed with two children, who are  in school. For over five years, he has been practicing dairy farming to make a living. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has been able to access loans to boost his business. In the next 5 years, he plans to expand his business. Moses has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Emma Benedicta

texts.en:
Emma dreams to go to Canada. She works toward that goal in order to provide the best quality of life for her family. Her dreams inspire her to work, and she believes that nothing is impossible if she strives. Emma is 36 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. With her experience working abroad for two years, she realizes that there is no easy way in life and she strives to do her best. 

With her passion to obtain her dreams, for the meantime, Emma decided to start a business raising hogs. She is thankful that she has been operating her business already for two years. She is doing her best to grow her business in order to attain her dreams. Emma wants to improve her business. She wants to buy additional piglets to raise so she can earn a higher income. Emma is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional piglets to raise. The loan will be a great help for her to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Chinarkul

texts.ru: Чинаркул 54 года, замужем и имеет троих детей.  Муж Кадырбек работает ветеринаром. Бизнес в разведении и откорме скота Чинаркул начала со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS), и смогла развить хозяйство с 5 коровами и 60 баранами, приносящее на сегодняшний день около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Бизнес, ставший семейным, имеет хорошую перспективу развития, так как село Асылбаш, где и живет Чинаркул с семьей, является очень хорошим местом для животноводства, так как рядом имеются пастбища для выпаса скота. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота , Чинаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Chinarkul is 54 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband, Kadyrbek, is a veterinarian. Chinakul started her business, breeding and raising livestock, with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS, and has expanded her farm to 5 cows and 60 rams, currently bringing in about 15,000 KGS per month. The farm, which has become a family business, has a promising future. The small town of Asylbash, where Chinarkul lives with her family, is an ideal place to raise animals, as there are many pastures for grazing livestock. With the goal of increasing the amount of livestock further, Chinarkul has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 KGS, to purchase cows. She plans to use the income obtained from investing the loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Nahason

texts.en: Nahason is a married man who is 31 years old. For the last three years, he has been running an electronics shop, where he sells radios and televisions to support his family. He also does farming to supplement his income. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a water pump for irrigation. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

loans.name: Earnest

texts.en: Earnest is a hardworking business man who is 28 years old and married. For the last three years, he has been running a welding business to support his family. Previously, he was employed. He has employed four people to assist him in the business. Earnest has been able to retain his business because of a good reputation with his customers. In the next five years, he plans to buy a piece of land. He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a grinder. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a grinder.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is married and blessed with one child. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. He has been running a welding business for the last three years to support his family. He also practices dairy farming to supplement his income. In the next 5 years, he plans to establish a wholesale business. Simon has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a welding machine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Suiumkan

texts.en:
Suiumkan, 55, is a widow who has raised a son and three daughters. The older children are married and live with their respective families. The younger daughters are students, and when they are not working on their studies, they help their mother with housework. In order to earn her livelihood Suiumkan sells meat at the market. She started this business in 1995 with an initial investment of 1000 soms. Her monthly profit is now about 5000 soms, which has enabled her to provide her children with an education. She wants to use her loan to purchase six livestock animals. In the future Suiumkan would like to open her own butcher shop.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society); Planet (remaining environmentally friendly); and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team: "Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance" at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase six livestock animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
"To accomplish great things we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe."
~ Anatole France

This quotation guides Rovelyn to work hard and love her work. Rovelyn is in her 40s with three children who are in elementary and high school. Rovelyn’s husband is a farmer, planting rice in the Philippines. With determination to help her husband uplift their standard of living, Rovelyn started a livestock business raising hogs. Rovelyn has two sows, 12 piglets and four fattening [hogs]. With the high cost of feed in the market, Rovelyn cannot provide enough feed for her hogs. Therefore, Rovelyn is taking out a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos to purchase feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Konwendsida Group

texts.fr:
Mme ELIANE JOSEPHE  est la représentante du groupe KONWENDSIDA. Elle est célibataire et mère de 01 enfant. Il a 04ans et fait la maternelle. Elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle fait la pédicure manucure et vend des mèches  depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché de secteur 10 .Ses clients sont les femmes et les  filles.

Elle veut  s’acheter  02 douzaines de mèche, 01 douzaine de vernis à ongle et un paquet d’ongles artificiels.

 Avec ses bénéfices, elle s’occupe de sa petite famille. Elle rêve  devenir une grande commerçante et faire des voyages sur Doubaï et la Chine.
texts.en:
Mrs ELIANE JOSEPHE is KONWENDSIDA Group's representative. She's single and the mother of one child, who is 4 years old and goes to kindergarten. She has one person to support.

For three years, she's been providing pedicure and manicure services, and selling hair extensions. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are women and girls.

She wants to buy two dozen hair extensions, one dozen units of nail varnish, and one pack of false nails. With her profits, she takes care of her little family. She dreams of becoming a big merchant and traveling to Dubai and China.

loans.use: to buy two dozen hair extensions, one dozen units of nail varnish, and one pack of false nails

loans.name: Mirva

texts.en: Mirva is a 32-year-old married Lebanese woman who lives with her husband and their child. She has been preparing and installing computer programs since 2007. She works from home and her husband, who serves in the Lebanese army, helps her cover the high cost of living. Today, she is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new computer with a full complement of accessories so that she can proceed with her business properly. She notes that this computer will help her improve her work, and therefore facilitate her program implementation. In the future, she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer with a full complement of accessories

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz is 50 years old, married, and has two children. For the past five years he has been selling construction materials. His wife helps him with the business. He is successful because his shop is located in the central bazaar. His monthly income from the business is 200 AZN. Now he is applying for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase more merchandise and increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise and increase his profits.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married and blessed with one child. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. He has been running a retail shop for the last two years to support his family. He also practices dairy farming to increase his income. In the next 5 years, he plans to establish a wholesale business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. With this loan of 20,000 KES he intends to buy sugar, cooking fat and rice for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and rice for resale.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 25-year-old married Lebanese man who lives with his wife and their child. He is putting all his efforts toward meeting his family’s needs. He has owned a car repair shop since 2007.  He specializes in repairing wheels, and also sells assorted spare parts. Today, he is asking to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new mechanic tools and supplies, as well as a wide variety of spare parts. In the future, he plans to apply for more Kiva loans in order to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanic tools and supplies, as well as a wide variety of spare parts.

loans.name: Balakarim

texts.en: Balakarim is 51 years old, married, and has two children. He runs a floral business, raising different flowers in his garden and selling them to the local vendors. He has 8 years of experience in this field. His monthly income from his business is 200 AZN. Now he would like to purchase more seeds and flowerpots to increase the number of flowers he sells. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and flowerpots

loans.name: David

texts.en: David, aged 36, is a single, hardworking businessman. For the last three years, he has been quarrying to make a living. He describes his business prospects as favorable since his potential customers are local residents. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. To that end, David has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a piece of land for quarrying. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for quarrying.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one milking cow and one calf.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a loving mother of two children. She is 24 years old and is married. To make a living, Josie raises hogs for breeding. Josie is lucky to be married to a farmer working in the Philippines. Her husband plants rice in their field. 
Josie wishes to continue to be a good wife and a good mother for her children . She also wishes to do her duty and be responsible for her family.  Josie is helping her husband to meet their family needs and wants to be able to send their children to school someday. 

Josie is requesting a loan of Php25,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She hopes the business does well and that she will become a successful businesswoman as well as a borrower.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Allahyar

texts.en: Allahyar is a 31 year-old man who sells seasonal fruits and vegetables, which he has done for the last 4 years.  His monthly income from this business is 200 AZN.  His wife actively helps him to run the business.  He applied for 1000 AZN loan to increase profits and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 49-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one child. He has owned a small garage in his town since 1985, where he provides car painting services. His wife has worked in a local pharmacy since 1990 in order to augment the family’s income. Today, he is asking to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., to buy painting products and materials so that he can better serve his customers.  In the future, he plans to open a bigger garage.

loans.use: To buy painting products and materials so that he can better serve his customers

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar is a 28-year-old young and vigorous trader. He is married and has 2 children. He sells food products as rice, cookies, confectioneries and beverages in the central market of Imishli city. He has 4 years of experience in this field. His monthly income is 250 AZN per month and he would like to increase it to 400. To make it possible he needs more capital to purchase more goods and meet customer demand. For this purpose he applied for 800 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell and generate more profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vacuum cleaners and washing machines to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Charbel

texts.en: Charbel is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He’s the main income source of his family. He has been working as an electrician for the past 17 years. His work consists of setting and installing home electricity. He works upon client’s requests and has one full-time employee helping him with the work. Today, he is applying for a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his business equipment which will definitely improve his work. His income is needed to help support his wife and three children.

loans.use: to renew his business equipment which will definitely improve his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to increase his income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nelsona

texts.en: Nelsona lives in West Point  and is 26 years old. She is  married  and has two children ages 4 and 1. They live at home and the older one is  presently in school. For the past years  Nelsona has been selling rice and vegetables. She enjoys  the way she sells and makes more profit. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more rice and vegetables   for her  business. Her plan is to  expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and vegetables   for her  business.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en: Michel is a 46-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent and a sibling. He has been working as a van driver transporting students. He has been involved in this type of business for the past 20 years. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to perform the needed maintenance on his van in order to secure its features, especially since he is transporting students of different ages and must be careful with his moves. In the future, he plans to start a new business which consists in organizing trips all over the country.

loans.use: To perform the needed maintenance on his van.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is 61 years old and he makes doors out of steel.  He has six years' experience in this field. He makes doors and gates according to the customer’s order. Also,  once a month he sells gates and doors in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 350 AZN. 

Adil is married and has three children. Now he has applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase materials to cover market demand.  Adil has already shown himself to be a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase working materials as steel and iron.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 49 years old and a single mother of a 20-year-old  child.  She has been providing mobile phone money transfers to earn a living.  She has been in the business for two years and has employed one person.  She also owns a barber shop where she earns extra income.

Rose hopes to grow her clientele in five years.  She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to add "float" for her money transfer business.

loans.use: To add "float" for her mobile phone money transfer business.

loans.name: Julios Ceasar

texts.en:
At 25, Julios already has three children. He is married to a housekeeper. To make a living and cover the needs of his family, Julios is working hard and his extra time is still spent in finding another source of income to ensure that he can cover his family's needs.

Julios is a farmer. He plants rice in their field in their village. He is also manages a hog-raising business. Julios has no time to go to their neighbors just for wasting time. He goes early in the morning to his field to do farming activities. After doing farming activities, Julios goes back home to feed his hogs and clean his piggery.

With regard to his hog-raising business, Julios is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He hopes to maintain the business and continue to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three calves

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir is 33, married with two sons. He has six years of experience in cattle breeding. He usually buys small calves, fattens them and sells for meat purposes in next 5-6 months.  His monthly income is 300 AZN.  Meat is in very high demand in Azerbiajan, and people here use meat in everyday cuisine. Nadir applied for 1300 AZN to purchase four calves and fodder. This will be his 2nd loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Helene

texts.en: Helene is 36 years, with 6 children who are between 3 and 14 years. She married to a commissioner. She sells clothes and she has been in the business for 2 years.
