She wants to add more bitenge (type of fabrics for ladies) clothes in her business with the loans she hopes to get. With the profits from the business, she expects to buy her own residential house.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 35 years old and married with 3 children, ages between 2 years and 7 years. He runs an electrical appliance and movies shop in Goderich, western Area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He also takes care of 1 relative at home. 

Henry has been in this business for 8 years and sells televisions, DVDs, discs, extensions, bulbs, cassettes, fans and switches at his shop. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that his business is doing well.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more electrical appliances. Henry says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his savings and take care of his children’s education. In the future, he would like to open another branch in different locations in town.

loans.use: To purchase more televisions, DVDs, extensions, cassettes and switches.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice for her  business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to increase his income

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 29 years old, married and blessed with a four-year-old child.  He sells mobile phone accessories to earn a living.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business. This is because he has been trained on business management skills.John has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Norlito

texts.en:
Norlito believes in the saying try and try until you succeed. There is no harm in trying, because he believes that the only failure in life is the failure to try. Norlito is 47 years of age, married and has five school-aged children.

Norlito is engaged in planting rice. Aside from planting rice, Norlito also manages a hog-raising business. He has been doing it for 14 years. His secret of long duration in managing his business is trying and trying until he develops his expertise in doing this type of business.

Norlito wants to maintain his hog-raising business. He had difficulties in sustaining his hog feed. That’s why he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feed for his hogs. He wishes to become a successful businessman and borrower, as well.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more construction materials

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha is 29 years old. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for three years. She has requested the loan to add more vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the profits for savings and paying school fees for the children. She dreams of having a large business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (her mother and sister). She has a restaurant at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last year. 

Oliver has requested a loan of 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, sweet and Irish potatoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and rainy seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and build rental houses. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Hannah from Goderich, the western area in Freetown. She is married with two children aged 10 years and 18 years. Her two children are currently attending school.

Hannah runs a crated drinks and bundled water store in Goderich, where she sells Fanta, Vinto and Coca-Cola. She has been running this business for nine years.  She also receives income from her husband who lives in England; he usually sends money to take care of their children. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of sufficient capital to invest in the business.

Hannah has requested a loan in order to buy more assorted drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to extend her business to international levels. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and bundled water.

loans.name: Catheline

texts.en: Catheline is 38 years old. She has six children aged between 5 and 14; all go to school. Catheline sells clothes and she has spent six years in that business. She has requested the loan to buy more clothes to sell. She expects to use the profits from the business to pay school fees and put aside savings. She has the anticipation of seeing her business grow to the extent of owning the large store.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maleaka

texts.en: Maleaka lives in West Point. At 36 years old, she is  married  and has three children ages 9 to 18. They are presently enrolled in school and  live at home. For the past  twelve years,  she has been selling soft drinks. She enjoys  the way customers  flow into her business. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her  business. Her plan is to send her children to school and  attend college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her  business.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 32 years old, married and blessed with two children.  To earn a living, she runs a mobile-phone money transfer business (M-Pesa).  She has been in the business for seven years and has employed three people.  Besides, she runs a cafeteria for extra income.

Monicah hopes to become a successful business lady.  She needs 100,000 Kenya shillings to add "float" to her business.

loans.use: To add "float" for her mobile-phone money transfer business.

loans.name: Rosa Adilia

texts.es: Rosa Adilia vive sola en su propia casa ya que la única hija que tiene ya es mayor de edad y está haciendo su propio hogar.  Rosa se caracteriza por ser una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo y dedicación el negocio es muy reconocido en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Para Rosa es muy importante mantener activo este negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Para ella lo más importante son los clientes ya que sabe que manteniéndolos satisfechos con el servicio que presta seguirán prefiriéndola y su negocio seguiría siempre activo tal como es su sueño. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda tales como: huevos, golosinas, azúcar, arroz, leche, frijoles, pan dulce y de más artículos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño de seguir mantenido activo su negocio y por consecuencia seguir trabajando por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Rosa Adilia lives alone in her own home as the only daughter who has come of age and making her own home. Rosa is a woman characterized by being honest, hardworking and above all very entrepreneurial. Several years ago she managed to establish a small convenience store in her home, and thanks to God and her hard work and dedication the business is well known in the area with many customers. 

It is very important to Rosa to keep active in this business as it is her main source of income. For her, the most important thing are her customers because she knows that keeping them satisfied with the service will have them continue to prefer her business.  This way, her business would always be active and that is her dream.  It is for this reason Rosa has decided to apply for this loan to INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of merchandise for the store such as eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, pastries and other articles that seem attractive to customers.  With this loan, Rosa hopes to achieve her dream of continuing her business and therefore continue to work for a better future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 45-year-old married woman with five children, all in school. She has had a business selling food items in Yei, South Sudan for five years. Esther requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase fish and beans for sale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Isatu from Lumley, in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children, 9  and 13 years old. In 2003, Isatu established her retail shop business because she needed a permanent source of income to support her family. Isatu also earns income from renting out a house. Her husband is a soldier and their 2 children are currently attending school. She says that the main challenge to her business is price fluctuations.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more crate drinks and provisions such as milk, sugar, Ovaltine and mayonnaise for her shop. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, Isatu plans to import goods from neighboring countries.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and crate drinks.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda de 57 años de edad, habita en su propia casa junto con su hija. Ella es una mujer increíble ya que a pesar de su avanzada edad no se cansa de trabajar y tiene muchas energías de seguir luchando por mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, específicamente a la venta de calcetas, calcetines y punteras. Este negocio lo ha realizado por mucho tiempo y gracias a su empeño los resultados obtenidos han sido muy favorables ya que Olinda se esfuerza para que los clientes siempre tengan lo que buscan en cuanto calidad, cantidad y  precios. Esto ha hecho que los clientes la prefieran y cada día su cartera de clientes es mayor. Su sueño es poder comprar mercadería al por mayor y ofrecer a un  número mayor de clientes. El objetivo es mejorar sus ventas e ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar calcetas, punteras y calcetines al por mayor. De esta manera espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
57-year-old Olinda lives in her own home together with her daughter.  She is an incredible woman because, in spite of her age, she doesn't tire of working and she has a lot of energy with which she continues striving to improve her own quality of life and that of her family.

Olinda's business is selling clothes (specifically full-length socks, ankle socks and toe warmers).  She has been in this business for a long time and, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work, her results have been good.  Olinda works hard to make sure that her customers always find what they are looking for in terms of quality, quantity and price.  This has made her loyal customers and her customer base grows every day.  Her dream is to be able to buy merchandise wholesale and offer her products to a larger number of customers.  Her goal is to improve her sales and income which will allow her to improve her quality of life.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy full-length socks, toe warmers and ankle socks wholesale.  In this way, she hopes to achieve her goal and improve both her own quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy full-length socks, toe warmers and ankle socks wholesale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old, married and has two children. She has six years of experience operating a tailoring business. She has employed one person to assist her in her tasks. She also relies on her husband for financial support.

Grace is thankful to Faulu Kenya for training her in financial management. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, 4 of whom attend school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Justine sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for the last year. Justine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Justine's goals and hopes are to own a truck for transporting green bananas from the villages of Masaka and to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Alba Dalila

texts.es: Alba Dalila de 35 años de edad, habita en casa familiar junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su madre, 2 hermanas y sobrinas. Alba se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, dedicada y sobre todo honesta. Ella se dedica a la venta de diferentes y deliciosos platillos típicos tales como: tortas, pasteles, papas fritas, etc. tiene muchos años de dedicase a este negocio y es el que le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La ubicación del negocio es bien estratégica ya que la zona es muy accesible y transitada por muchas personas. Su sueño es agrandar su negocio y verlo florecer. Para cumplir su sueño ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de activo fijo: sillas, mesas, plancha y tambo. De esta manera espera mejorar el servicio que ofrece a sus clientes con el fin de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos de  tal forma que su calidad de vida y la de su familia se mejore.
texts.en: 35-year-old Alba Dalila lives in a family home together with her family group which consists of her mother, two sisters and nieces.  Alba is noted as being tenacious, committed and, above all, an honest woman.  Her business is selling delicious traditional dishes such as flans, pies, fries, etc.  She has been in this business for many years and it has allowed her to provide for her household.  Her business location is very strategic as the area is very accessible and busy with people.  Her dream is to expand her business and see it thrive.  In order to achieve her dream, she has taken the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL in order to invest in fixed assets (tables, chairs, a grill and a gas canister).  In this way, she hopes to improve the service she offers her customers with the aim of improving her sales and income in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (tables, chairs, grill and gas canister)

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 30 years old and married, with 2 children aged 3 and 7 years old. She owns a business selling secondhand clothes in the market. She has 8 years of experience in this business, working from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. 5 days a week. She currently employs two people to help her. 

Donatha has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dulcinea De Las Flores

texts.es: Dulcinea D. las Flores D. 38 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y dos hijos. Dulcinea es una mujer increíble la cual ha trabajado toda su vida para llevar el pan D. cada día a su hogar. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar D. residencia en la cual venD. variedad D. productos tales como: cereales, detergente, golosinas, aceite, pan dulce, y muchas cosas más que los clientes prefieren. Ella se caracteriza por ser emprendedora y muy  arriesgada. Su sueño es ver florecer su negocio y poder aspirar a una mejor calidad D. vida. Todo esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la comprar D. artículos tales como: cereales, aceite, golosinas, detergen, pan dulce, papel y D. mas productos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. Tiene plena confianza en Dios y en sus esfuerzos que D. esta manera logrará sacar adelante a su familia y podrá mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Dulcinea D. las Flores, 38, lives in her own house with her family comprised of her husband and two children.  Dulcinea is an incredible woman who has been working her entire life to bring daily bread to her home.  Several years ago she managed to establish a small, home-based little store where she sells a variety of products like: cereals, detergent, snacks, oil, sweet bread and many other things her customers prefer.  She is noted for being very enterprising and daring.  Her dream is to see her business flourish and to attain a better quality of life.

All this motivates her to request this INTEGRAL loan to invest in her business buying such items as: cereals, oil, snacks, detergent, sweet bread, paper and other products that are attractive to customers.  She has full trust in God and in her efforts that she will manage to move her family forward and improve their quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Amua Group

texts.en:
Robert takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Robert had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Robert was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Robert will educate his children and save for the future.

Robert is the facilitator of the Amua group. In the photograph above, Robert is pictured with his group members. Robert and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Amua group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Robert and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 34 years old and married, with two children, neither of whom attend school. She has operated a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Agnes requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal for resale. She will use her extra income to pay for her children to attend school.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 25 years old and a single-mother with an eight-year-old child.  To earn a living, she sells mobile phone airtime cards.  She has been in the business for five years and has employed one person.  She also supplies yogurt to shops to supplement her income.

She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping her to boost her business with her previous loan.  She needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone airtime cards.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone air-time cards

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 48 years old and married with four children. She takes care of three children. Venantie owns a restaurant business selling food and drinks such as beans, rice, potatoes, bananas, meat, soda etc.

This is her fifth successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 6 am until 8:30 pm every day. She currently employs two people to help her.

Venantie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her restaurant by buying more food and soft drinks such as beans, rice, potatoes, bananas, meat, soda etc to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save in her future, reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant by buying more food and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children. Four of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (grand children). She raises poultry from home on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for many years. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to purchase more bags of poultry feed and vaccines. Her major business challenges are transportation of bags of chicken feeds from Mengo Kisenyi to her home and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to own 1,000 laying birds and to build more houses for her poultry. She lives in her own house. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and vaccines

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new supplies such as knifes, food mixer, electrical equipment, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 6 children, 4 of whom attend school. She has one additional family member. Ruth lives in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

Ruth sells secondhand bags at the market on a wholesale basis. She works seven days a week and has been in business for the last 10 years. Ruth has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more secondhand bags. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Ruth's goals and hopes are to become a wholesaler, to start importing secondhand bags and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand bags

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 32-year-old married man. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. He has been operating  a quarrying business for the last ten years to support his family. His potential customers are local residents. In the next 5 years, Paul wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a piece of land for quarrying. Since Paul joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for quarrying.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 32 years old and married, with three children, two of them in school. She has operated a business selling groundnuts and cooking oil in Yei, South Sudan, for four years. Lucy requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase groundnuts and cooking oil for resale. She will use her extra income to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts and cooking oil.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en: Heba is a 22-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child. Heba has worked as a hairdresser on a freelance basis since 2008, serving customers at her home. She decided to start her own business after seeing that her husband, who works as an employee in a local company, hardly covers the heavy expenses. Heba is requesting a loan of $600 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Busakala F.a Group

texts.en:
Joseph is the facilitator of the Busakala FA group. Joseph and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. Joseph takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Joseph was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½  acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Joseph will educate his children and invest in livestock raising. 

In 2012, the members of Busakala FA group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Joseph is pictured with his group members and the field officer appears on the far left. One member is absent.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 30-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. In 2004, he was able to start his own business working as a construction laborer. He has been involved in this occupation for more than 10 years. Ali works really hard and has two part-time employees assisting him. Today, he’s looking to borrow $1,000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional construction equipment to continue his work appropriately. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction equipment

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 6 children and only 4 of her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on retail basis. She also has a retail shop where she generates additional income. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She has requested for a loan of 800000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of oranges, pineapples and mangoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to increase on her capital base so as to serve more customers and also to become a wholesaler and a farmer of fruits. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy boxes of oranges pineapples and mangoes

loans.name: Maema A Group

texts.en:
Timothy is the facilitator of the Maema M group. Timothy and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Timothy takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to have additional maize profits to educate his children and to access fertilizers and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Timothy had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Timothy was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Timothy and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Timothy will educate his children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Maema M group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Timothy is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Roudayna

texts.en: Roudayna is a 34-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two siblings. She is the main owner of an accessories shop. She has been working hard in her store for the past three years. She sells women's accessories such as bags, necklaces, bracelets, rings and perfumes. She cooperates with her father to pay the family expenses. Today, she is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her store’s inventory of accessories and perfumes to attract more customers and therefore increase her sales. In the future, she plans to add women's clothes to her shop.

loans.use: To increase her store’s inventory of accessories and perfumes to attract more customers and therefore increase her sales

loans.name: Simperu

texts.en: Simperu is a single man aged 22. He has been operating a business selling goats to make a living. He has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. His potential customers are the local residents and passerby. In the next 5 years, he plans to expand his business. He has requested for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy more goats for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy goats.

loans.name: Selestina

texts.en: Selestina is 47 years old a married woman with five children. Two of them are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei South Sudan for six years. Selestina requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Federesi

texts.en: Federesi lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 7 children and only three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells sweet bananas at the market on rent basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She has requested a loan of 500000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of sweet bananas. Federesi genreates additional income through working as a sweeper in Kampala City council. Her major business challenges are ever increasing prices of sweet bananas and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in a  rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to  piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas

loans.name: Dioubo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 07 Juin 2004. Le nom signifie "entente" en langue locale wolof. L'activité principale de ses 12 membres est le commerce de détail.
Mme Marie est membre du groupe dont elle est responsable depuis sa création, elle est debout à gauche de la photo avec la main levée. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.Elle a une bonne expérience de son activité pour l'avoir exercée depuis plus de 10 ans. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des tissus, des bijoux et des chaussures qu'elle va revendre.
Avec les bénéfices, Mme Marie va aider son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The group was created on June 7, 2004. The name means harmony or understanding in the local language, Wolof. The main activity of its twelve members is retail sales. Marie is the member of the group who has been its director since its creation. She is standing with a raised hand on the right side of the photo. She is married and the mother of two children. She has a proven track record in her profession, which she has practiced for over ten years.
With this loan, she intends to buy fabric, jewelry, and shoes that she will resell.
With the earnings, Marie will help her husband with the care of the family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes, and jewelry.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Mary is 20 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, one of whom attends school. For the past year, Mary has been working hard to manage her outside catering, selling popcorn. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more popcorn for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to start selling food. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mary's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more popcorn for resale

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 27-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He has been working as a car mechanic since 2005 and has worked for 10 years. Despite his young age, he works thoughtfully to offer a worthy and respectful life to his family. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase mechanical tools to improve his business thus his effectiveness. In the future, he plans to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: To purchase mechanical tools to improve his business

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 07 juin 2004. Il compte une quinzaine de membres qui ont pour activité principale le commerce. 

Mme Sadio est responsable du groupe. sur la photo, elle est debout à gauche avec la main levée et une écharpe blanche autour du cou.

Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle confectionne du savon et le vend au marché hebdomadaire de la localité.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'acheter de la matière première pour augmenter sa production de savon.

Avec les bénéfices générés, elle va aider son mari pour la scolarité et la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The group was created June 7, 2004. It includes around fifteen members who work principally in sales. Sadio is the director of the group. In the photo, she is standing at the right with her hand raised and a white scarf around her neck.
She is married and the mother of two children. She makes soap and sells it at the weekly market in her area.
This loan will allow her to buy raw materials in order to increase her production of soap.
With the profits generated, she will help her husband with the schooling and health of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make soap.

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Rebecca is 17 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy charcoal for resale, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to become a lawyer. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rebecca's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Jyambere Muhinzi Zone 3 Group

texts.fr:
Frodouard fait partie du groupe Jyamberemuhinzi. Il a 48 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 1 semaine à 18 ans, Dont 3 scolarisés. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6  ans de primaire.

Frodouard est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la race améliorée du riz.  Dans les prochaines années, Frodouard voudrait être le fournisseur du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’ d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Frodouard is part of the group Jyamberemuhinzi. He is forty-eight years old and married with six children, with ages ranging from one week to eighteen years, including three who are in school. He supports one person other than his children. His level of education is six years of primary school.

Frodouard is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice farming.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to grow the improved breed of rice. In the coming years, Frodouard would like to be the rice supplier. With the profits, he foresees educating and caring for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice farming.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a 33-year-old hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last ten years, Kennedy has been involved in the car wash business to support his family. He also runs a retail shop to supplement his income. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Kennedy has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a water tank. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy a water tank for his car wash.

loans.name: Feyrouz

texts.en: Feyrouz is a 50-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children, all of whom still attend school. Feyrouz has owned a women's beauty salon since 1998. Over the years, she was able to gain a good number of customers and was even able to hire one full-time employee. Due to some bad circumstances, Feyrouz is asking to borrow $2,500 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase cosmetics and a makeup trolley in order to reinforce and strengthen her business. In the future, she plans to open a new branch of her shop.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and a makeup trolley

loans.name: Nuela

texts.en: Nuela is a 22 year old married woman and has two children, none of them are in school. She has a business of selling food items in Yei South Sudan for three years. Nuela requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase bean and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, married and blessed with one child who is in school, describes herself as a hardworking business woman. She has been running a retail shop for the last four years to support her family, and enjoys a good business reputation with her customers.

Lilian is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar and rice for resale. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training her in good customer care, and within the next five years plans to establish a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Rhitah

texts.en:
Rhitah is married and has three children who attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and feeding her family. 

Rhitah rears poultry from her home on retail basis, which she has been doing for eight months. She works seven days a week. She generates additional income through selling second-hand clothes. 

Rhitah is requesting a loan for 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more poultry feeds and vaccines.  Her major business challenges are transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations are to become a big poultry farmer and to build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of chicken feeds and vaccines.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en: Valerie is 25 years old and married to a driver. She sells charcoal and she has been doing this for more than two years. She has asked for the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. She believes that the profits from this business will be used to create savings.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Matisi Sgh Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Matisi SGH Group in Western Kenya! Rosemary is the facilitator of the Matisi SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rosemary takes care of 11 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund because of a good harvest and because One Acre Fund has the best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Rosemary had a very good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rosemary was only able to harvest 2.4 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rosemary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rosemary will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Matisi SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the above photo, Rosemary appears with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is a 27-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He has owned a sportswear shop since 2004. He sells sportswear and wide range of related equipment and accessories. 

With his requested loan of $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, Aziz will be able to purchase warmth suits, equipment, and many other products.  He states that the ski season is about to begin and he must be ready to satisfy his customer’s demands. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his business profits by 10%.

loans.use: To purchase warmth suits, equipment, and many other products.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara lives in Ljevan with her husband, her daughter, son and daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren.  Since 1992 she has managed her own café.  Tamara’s husband is a musician who doesn't work regular hours, and he often helps Tamara with her business.

When she started her business, Tamara had a small café, but for the past 19 years it has grown as she has reinvested her profits back into her business.  For example, Tamara was able to buy the neighboring land to enlarge her business, remodel her café, buy addiitonal equipment for the café, and to buy a car that's used for café business.  With the income from her café Tamara has also been able to support her big family, 

Tamara’s café is very popular in Ljevan thanks to its cleanliness and her good service.   Tamara used her first Kiva-funded loan to buy a projector and screen for her café so she can show music videos in order to attract younger customers.  Now Tamara is requesting a loan of 700,000 AND to buy new tables and chairs for her café.

loans.use: to buy new tables and chairs for her cafe

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a hardworking businessman aged 58.  He is married and blessed with four children.

Nelson has been running a butcher shop for the last four years to support his family. He also practices dairy farming to increase his income. Nelson employs two people at his butcher shop.

Nelson plans to use this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan from Kiva field partner Faulu Kenya to buy a cow to slaughter.  In the next five years, he plans to open another outlet of his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow to slaughter

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is aged 28 and is married with four children. Only one of her children attends school.

Jeanette has worked as a tailor for more than four years. She has requested this loan to buy an additional sewing machine. If she is able to realize extra profits from her business, she plans to buy more fabric for use in her tailoring.

loans.use: to buy an extra sewing machine

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a 26-year-old married woman with three children. All of the children are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for four years. Angelina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe B/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Donatien fait partie du groupe Abunzubumwe B/Rsz. Il a 40 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 1 à 13 ans, Dont 4 scolarisés. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3  ans de secondaire.

Isaïe est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la race améliorée du riz.  Dans les prochaines années, Isaïe voudrait être le fournisseur du riz. Avec les profits, Isaïe prévoit d’éduquer soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Donatien is a member of Abunzubumwe B/Rsz Group. He's 40 years old, married, and has five children, age 1 to 13. Out of them, four attend school. He also has one other person to support. He attended middle school for three years.

Donatien is a rice cultivator, who's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growing his business consists in using an enhanced rice variety. In the forthcoming years, he would like to become a rice provider.

With his profits, he intends to provide education and healthcare to his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 5 children who all go to school. She takes care of an additional family member (her sister's child). Irene owns a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She works 6 days a week and has been in business for the last 10 years. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, and cassava. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to build rental houses. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, and cassava.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 46-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s unfortunately divorced and living with her three children.  In 2007, she opened a clothing store and started to sell stylish clothes in addition to selling scarves. Because of her friendly and welcoming nature, she is able to have a big clientele. Today, she is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to diversify her merchandise selection and buy the new winter clothes collection. In the future, she hopes to sell shoes and bags from her shop in addition to clothes.

loans.use: To diversify her merchandise selection and buy the new winter clothes collection

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 36 years old and married to Ruth who is a business lady. They are blessed with one child who is two years old. He has been operating a motorbike transport service as his primary business and livestock broker as his secondary business for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 7,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff. Paul will use the loan to buy a heifer and animal feeds. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will service the motorbike. His hopes and dreams are to concentrate more on his motorbike transportation, which will help him educate his children up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy a heifer and animal feed

loans.name: Isuka Group

texts.fr:
Josué fait partie du groupe Isuka. Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 3 à 5 ans, Dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Josué est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique sélectionné.  Dans les prochaines années, Josué voudrait agrandir la surface de la culture du riz en achetant d’autres champs. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’ d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Josué is a member of Isuka Grouo. He's 28 years old, married, and has two children, age 3 and 5. One of them attends school. His own level of education amounts to five years of elementary school.

Josué is a rice cultivator. He's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growing his business is to use selected chemical fertilizers. In the forthcoming years, Josué would like to expand the area of his rice farm, by purchasing other fields.

With his profits, he intends to educate and provide healthcare to his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Pasklina

texts.en:
Pasklina is 35 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. She has had a business selling clothes for five years in Yei, South Sudan.

Pasklina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos vive con su esposa y dos hijos, es casado, es trasportista de cargas, realiza viajes a domicilio a sus clientes, transaporta maiz, concentrado, frijoles y de todo tipo de material, este trabajo lo realiza hace ya varios años.
El esta solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la reparación de su vehiculo, esta inversión le ayuda a brindar una mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes, ya que la reparación de su vehiculo es fundamental para brindar un mejor trabajo a su clientela.
Su mayor sueño es tener mayores ingresos y esto lo ayudara a darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and two children.  He’s married and works hauling cargo.  He makes trips to his customers’ homes transporting corn, feed concentrate, beans and all types of material; he’s been in this business several years now.

He is asking for a loan to repair his vehicle.  This investment will help him provide better customer service because repairing his vehicle is fundamental to better customer service provision.  His greatest dream is to hear higher income which will help him give his wife and children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children, who are still attending school. He provides the only source of income for the family. He has owned a poultry shop since 2003 and he’s well known by his generosity and cleanliness. Today, Hussein is asking to borrow $800 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new equipment, such as a grilling machine and other baking tools. These purchases will help him increase his business productivity and his sales, also increasing his income. In the future, he looks forward to opening his own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy new equipment, such as a grilling machine and other baking tools.

loans.name: Twisungane 23 B/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Isaïe fait partie du groupe Twisungane 23 B/Rsz. Il a 27 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 2 à 4 ans. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Isaïe est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionnée du riz.  Dans les prochaines années, Isaïe voudrait agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Avec les profits, Isaïe prévoit de soigner son enfant.
texts.en:
Isaïe is a member of Twisungane 23 B/Rsz Group. He's 27 years old, married, and has three children, age 2 to 4. He has one other person to support. His level of education amounts to six years of elementary school.

Isaïe is a rice cultivator. He's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growing his business is to grow selected rice seeds. In the forthcoming years, he would like to expand the area of his rice farm. With his profits, he intends to provide healthcare to his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Kipetuan

texts.en:
Kipetuan has been practicing farming in Naivasha town for the last 24 years.  Besides farming, he also ventures in the quarrying business.  He is 51 years old, married to Maria and they have two school going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its field officers and this will be his third loan.  He paid off his previous loans, and in good time. 

He plans to use this loan amount to increase the labor force in his quarry so he may increase his production and income.

In the future, Kipetuan hopes to buy a new lorry and own many quarries, sell the stones and expand his business to other parts of the country.

loans.use: to increase the labor force in his quarry.

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en:
Nazih (face is hidden) is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and two children; one of them attends school. 

He has been working as a car blacksmith for the past 14 years.  He opened his own car body repair shop in 2009.  

Today, Nazih’s asking to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an air compressor and mechanical equipment.  

This will be his first Kiva loan and he is sure that it will help him achieve substantial growth in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase an air compressor and mechanical equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn on the cob, corn and condiments.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has operated his butchery shop in Naivasha town for the last six years.  He is 41 years old, married to Mercy and they have two school going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy more goats to sustain and boost his butchery business.

In the future, Simon hopes to open another butcher shop in Naivasha, thereby increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sustain and boost his butchery business.

loans.name: Chandiru

texts.en:
Chandiru is a 32 year old married woman with five children.  She sells charcoal in South Sudan and has done so for four years.

Chandiru requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She says the extra income will helps her build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Review Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old and married to Salome.  They are blessed with two children, ages 12 and 15 years.

Joseph sells clothes to the residents of Tala market where there is a good flow of customers.  He has been in this business for the last four years and makes a monthly income of KES.15,000.

Joseph has a got good credit history with KADET and he is applying for his second loan of KES.30,000 to buy second hand clothes for children and adults.  He will use the extra profit to pay fees and to provide food for the family.

Joseph hopes to own a boutique. He is very hardworking and focused.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years.  She is 47 years old, and has two grown children who are also farmers.  

She was introduced to KADET  LTD by one of its field officers and this will be her first loan.  Hannah plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Hannah hopes to improve her farming skills and plant more crops on her farm land, thereby increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, es casado, es propietaria de una venta, dicho negocio lo comenzó por su propia iniciativa, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio, no tiene un horario establecido ya que lo tiene instalado en su casa.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de artículos para surtir su tienda, aceite, embutidos, huevos, arroz, frijoles, azucar, ya que es demandada por su clientela, esta compra le ayudara a atender mejor a sus clientes brindarles lo que necesitan y mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Rosa es ampliar su negocio, incrementar la clientela y vivir feliz con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and two children.  She is married and owns her own business.  She started her business on her own initiative and has experience.  She does not work regular hours as her business is located in her home.

Rosa is requesting this loan to buy items with which to stock her store: oil, cold cuts, eggs, rice, beans and sugar, as these are in demand with her customers.  This purchase will help her to better serve her customers, provide them with what they need, and improve her income.

Rosa's dream is to expand her business, increase her number of customers and live happily together with her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, cold cuts, eggs, rice, beans and sugar

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has practiced horticultural farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past year.  He is 51 years old, married to Wanjiru and they have four school going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its existing clients and this will be his second loan.  He paid off his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs as well as for labor purposes.

In the future, James hopes to expand his horticulture business and make more profits and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs as well as for labor purposes.

loans.name: Nohad

texts.en:
Nohad (standing, face hidden) is a 30-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child, who attends school. 

He has owned a barbershop since 2003.  In parallel, he has also worked as a driver for a locA. company since 2006 in order to generate a higher income to support his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase shaving tools and products. 

He plans to expand his business and focus on being a barber.  In the future, he plans to hire a full-time employee.

loans.use: to purchase shaving tools and products.

loans.name: Ana Yancy

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su mama y sus hermanos, es soltera, dueña de una tienda, el negocio lo comenzó gracias al apollo de su madre quien siempre se a dedicado al negocio, tiene experiencia en el  y no cuenta con un horario establecido de trabajo.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos para su tienda como aceite, maíz, arroz y demás, esta compra le ayudara a crecer en el negocio, tener mas clientela y mejorar sus ganancias.
La aspiracion de Ana es tener un negocio mas grande, tener su propia casa y vivir feliz con su familia con mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her mother and siblings.  She’s single and owns a store.  The store began with support from her mother who has always been in business.  She has experience in it and does not have a fixed work schedule.

She’s asking for a loan to buy more products for her store like: corn, oil, rice and others.  This purchase will help her business grow, to have more customers and to improve her profits.  Ana’s hope is to have a bigger business, own her own house and to live happily with her family with better income.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: La señora Eva es comerciante, vende ropa y todo tipo de muebles en distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mas mercadería en este caso ropa para niños ya que se acerca la época de navidad y las ventas suben. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que Eva obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también en Kiva.
texts.en: Eva’s a merchant.  She sells clothes and all types of furniture in various street markets in the city of El Alto.  She needs the loan to buy more merchandise, in this case children’s clothes, because the Christmas season is approaching and sales increase.  She lives in a rented house in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz.  This is the first time Eva has gotten an IMPRO and a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: En una esquina de su propio barrio Leonarda, mujer de 58 años de edad,  emprendió su gran aventura de negocio desde hace 8 años, cuando creó su propio restaurante.  El que fue poco a poco creciendo, porque ella ahorrando de sus ganancias amplió su infraestructura con la cual logró captar la atención de un importante mercado, porque siempre ha pensado en lograr deleite y comodidad para sus clientes. Dia a día Leonarda sueña con mejorar su restaurante aún más y aumentar sus ganancias, pero su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente,  para responder al potencial de clientes que están en su medio. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la a Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  refrescos, y víveres para producir en más cantidad y lograr compras a menor precio por el volumen de estas, lo cual representaría un impacto en sus ventas especialmente en la época de fin de año, en la cual se incrementan y esto lo dice su experiencia. Su mayor desafío es lograr una infraestructura física que ofrezca un ambiente totalmente confortable a sus clientes y lograr un completo bienestar para su familia, conformada por su esposo y sus 6 hijos en las edades de 17 a 40 años.
texts.en:
In a corner in her own neighborhood, Leonarda, a 58-year-old woman, started her great business adventure 8 years ago when she opened her own restaurant.  It has gradually grown because by saving her profits she expanded its infrastructure and cornered a significant market segment because she’s always watchful of her customers’ comfort and delight.

Leonarda dreams daily with improving the restaurant still more and increasing her profits.  But her working capital is insufficient to respond to potential clientele in the environment.  This is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy soft-drinks and foodstuffs to produce more and to be able to buy supplies in volume thus at a lower price which will impact sales especially during this end-of-year season when, according to her experience, sales increase.  Her greatest challenge is attaining a physical infrastructure that provides a completely comfortable environment for her customers and to attain total wellbeing for her family which is composed of her husband and six children whose ages range from 17 to 40.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan vive con su esposa y un hijo, es agricultor y ganadero, los negocios los aprendio por su papá quien siempre se a dedicado a la agricultura y la ganadería, tiene experiencia en los negocios y no cuenta con un horario establecido de trabajo ya que trabaja solo y en lo propio.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos para engordar, esta compra le ayudara a incrementar la granja y las ventas y a mejorar los ingresos económicos en su hogar.
El proposito de Juan es tener un negocio grande y darle el estudio a su hijo hasta sacar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and son.  He is a farmer and also raises livestock.  He learned these businesses from his dad who has always worked in farming and livestock raising.  Juan has experience in his businesses.  He does not work regular hours as he works alone and is self employed.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy pigs to fatten.  This purchase will help him to increase the size of his farm and his sales.  He will also improve his household income.

Juan's goal is to have a big business and to provide his son with an education until he gains his university degree.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La señora Sandra tiene una empresa de turismo y su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada. El crédito lo requiere para la ampliación y remodelación de los ambientes de su oficina. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Alto Sopocachi  de la ciudad de La Paz; Sandra es casada y tiene dos hijos. Esta es la primera vez que su préstamo va vía Kiva y la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO.
texts.en: Sandra has a tourist agency and her husband is employed at a private firm.  She needs the loan to enlarge and remodel her office.  She lives in her parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Sopocachi zone.  Sandra is married and has two children.  This is the first time that her loan is via Kiva and the fourth time she’s requested an IMPRO loan.

loans.use: to enlarge and remodel her tourist agency.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, es casada y vendedora de tamales al igual que propietaria de una tienda donde ofrece artículos de toda necesidad, dichos negocios surgieron por iniciativa propia y con la ayuda y apoyo de su esposo, cuenta con experiencia en ambos negocios.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de churros, galletas, gaseosas, jugos y de mas artículos de primera necesidad, ya que es demanda por sus clientes, esta compra le ayudara a surtir mas la tienda, mejorar el inventario y mejorar los ingresos.
La aspiracion de Reina es mantener el negocio, ampliar la tienda y generar mas ingresos económicos para su familia.
texts.en:
Reina lives with her husband and three children. She is married and sells tamales and at the same time is an owner of a general store. These businesses came about through her own initiative and with the help and support of her husband, and she has been getting experience in both businesses. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy churros [fritters shaped like a long cylinder made from flour and powdered sugar], cookies, soft drinks, juices and other more items more essential, which her customers ask for. This purchase will help her stock the store, improve the inventory and increase her income. 

Reina’s dream is to maintain the business, expand the store and create more profit for her family,

loans.use: to buy churros, cookies, soft drinks, and juices

loans.name: Patricia Marisol

texts.es:
Patricia, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, es casada, dueña de una venta de juguetes, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 5 años y los vende fuera de iglesias y centros escolares, es por ello que no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio, que es juguetes plastiscos, esta compra le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y obtener mas ganancias económicas para su hogar.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos darles a ellos un estudio adecuado hasta terminar siendo formados academicamente.
texts.en:
Patricia lives with her husband and three children.  She’s married and sells toys.  She’s been in this business for five years and sells them outside churches and schools so she does not have a fixed work schedule.

She’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her business, which is plastic toys.  This purchase will help her have higher income and obtain more profits for her home.

Her greatest wish is to improve her and her children’s quality of life and to give them adequate schooling so that they will become well-formed academically.

loans.use: to buy plastic toys.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 25 year old business man, who is single.  He is a crop farmer and a motorbike transport driver to generate extra income.

Farming has been his business for the past ten years and his monthly income is about KES 10,000.  This helps him cover the cost of his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Andrew will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.  

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will service his motorbike.  His hopes and dreams are to focus on building his transportion business to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Hasib

texts.en:
Hasib (face hidden) is a 46-year-old man from Lebanon.  He is married and has three school-aged children. 

After gaining 26 years of experience in the car mechanical field, he opened his own car smithy garage in 1990. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his children’s educational fees, in order to avoid facing financial problems with the school's management. 

He wishes the best for his children and hopes that they will attain a high level of education.  This will be his second Kiva loan, and we note that he has a very good repayment history.

loans.use: to pay his children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Rolando Alberto

texts.es:
Ronaldo vive con su esposa y un hijo, es casado, se dedica a la agricultura, este trabajo lo inicio por su propia iniciativa, no tiene un horario establecido que le permita laborar, cuenta con experiencia ya que lo realiza desde hace mucho tiempo.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de 6 sacos de abono para la siembra, esta compra le ayudara a sacar una buena cosecha y a mejorar sus ingresos económicos en el hogar.
Su mayor sueño es crecer económicamente para sacar adelante a su familia y darle el estudio adecuado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ronaldo lives with his wife and son.  He’s married and works in farming.  He started this work on his own initiative.  He does not have a fixed work schedule.  He has experience since he’s been doing this for a very long time.

He’s asking for a loan to buy six sacks of manure for his crops.  This purchase will help him produce a good harvest and improve his home’s income.  His greatest dream is to grow economically to move his family forward and give his children an adequate education.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of manure.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and four children who are still attending school. He has been working in the construction field for the past 10 years, specialized in floor covering.  In 2008, he decided to start working independently. Today, he’s applying for a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s school fees. Youssef’s main goal is to allow his children to pursue their education properly until graduating.

loans.use: To pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Vilma Cristina

texts.es:
Vilma vive con su esposo y su hija, es casada y propietaria  de una venta de ropa y de calzado, cuenta con experiencia laboral ya que hace siete años trabaja en ello, cuenta con un local propio en el mercado.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mas ropa nueva (vestidos casual, blusas, faldas) y variedad de calzado para la temporada que se acerca, esta compra le ayudara mejorar el inventario, satisfacer a sus clientes y mejorar los ingresos económicos.
El sueño de Vilma es mantener el negocio ampliar el inventario agregando nuevos productos y generar mas ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Vilma lives with her husband and daughter.  She’s married and sells clothes and shoes.  She has work experience because she’s been working at this for seven years.  She has her own locale in the market.

She’s asking for a loan to buy more new clothes (casual dresses, blouses and skirts) and an assortment of shoes for the approaching season.  This purchase will help her improve her inventory and satisfy customer and improve income.  Vilma’s dream is to stay in business, to expand inventory adding new products and to generate higher family income.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en: Akram is a 39-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. Due to the technologicA. innovation and in order to make an exceptionA. evolution in his town, he decided to open his own computer network in 2007 where people meet every day to enjoy their time. He’s really happy with the results he has attained so far. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy more computers in order to expand his business and satisfy his customers. In the future, he plans to open a new branch of his shop.

loans.use: To buy more computers in order to expand his business and satisfy his customers

loans.name: Mayra Luisa

texts.es: Mayra Luisa de 48 años labora como docente de primaria. Tiene 2 hijos, lucha todos los días para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Mayra es una mujer feliz, tiene su vivienda a la que necesita realizarle modificaciones es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para la compra de cemento, bloques, arena entre otros. Estas mejoras que quiere realizar son necesarias para su familia y al mismo tiempo será beneficioso para ella.
texts.en: Mayra Luisa, 48, works as an elementary school teacher.  She has two children and strives daily to improve her family’s quality of life.  Mayra is a happy woman; she has her house that needs improvement and that’s why she’s asking for a loan to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand, among others.  These improvements she wants to do are necessary for her family and will be beneficial for her as well.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand, among others.

loans.name: Emma Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Emma Rosa de 38 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 14 años de edad, quienes están estudiando en la escuela,  vive en una aldea de Ceguaca, Santa Bárbara tiene 15 años de casada.
Desde hace un año, Emma estableció un negocio de elaboración y venta de tajadas de plátano, en esta comunidad.  Anteriormente lo tenía en San Pedro Sula y lo inicio con fondos propios. Ahora que vive en esta comunidad le va mejor ya que nadie más hace esta actividad y tiene mucha demanda. Además le sale más rentable porque en la zona se consigue el plátano mas barato y gana más. El negocio es administrado por ella y su esposo. Tiene la oportunidad de vender en las pulperías de la comunidad y alrededores.
Este es su primer préstamo y lo utiliza para comprar insumos para elaborar el producto como  es el plátano, sal barbacoa y sal saborizada, bolsas y aceite.
texts.en:
Emma Rosa, 38, has two children who are 11 and 14 years old and are going to school.  She lives in village in Ceguaca, Santa Bárbara; she’s been married for 15 years.

A year ago Emma started making and selling fried banana chips in this community.  She used to do so in San Pedro Sula and she started it with funds of her own.  Now she lives in this community and she does better because no one else does this same activity and she is in high demand.  Besides, it’s more profitable because the bananas are less expensive here so profits are higher.  She and her husband run the business.  She has the opportunity to sell to local and nearby grocery stores.

This is her first loan and she will use it to buy ingredients needed to make her product like bananas, barbecue salt, flavored salt, bags and oil.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make banana chips like salt, bags, bananas and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy party dresses, blouses, skirts and pants.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a 44-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He has been working as a home painter for the past 25 years. He works on a freelance basis serving a wide clientele. After finding it hard to cover his children’s educational fees and the other family expenses, he decided to double his efforts and take more projects to gain higher income.  And today, he is asking to borrow $3000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy painting products as he is about to start a new project and must cater to the demands of his customers. In the future, he plans to open a painting shop.

loans.use: To buy painting products as he is about to start a new project and must cater to the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Karimeh

texts.en: Karimeh is a 61-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. Despite her older age, she has been working as a farmer for the past 20 years. She is specialized in cultivating vegetables according to the season. She works hard in collaboration with her husband to provide better living conditions to the family.  Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizers and seeds to increase her business productivity and help her harvested products grow faster. In the future, she plans to hire a part-time employee to work on her behalf.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds to increase her business productivity and help her harvested products grow faster

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, es casado, vendedor de granos básicos, se a dedicado a dicho negocio hace ya cuatro años trabaja de lunes a sábado, y algunas veces lo hace ambulantemente en cantones en un carro de su propiedad.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles, café entre otros, esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su inventario y a obtener mejores ganancias.
El sueño de José es tener una mejor calidad de vida y ofrecerles a sus hijos mejores oportunidades de estudio hasta llegar hacer graduados de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and four children.  He’s married and a basic grains merchant.  He’s been in this business four years now and works Monday through Saturday.  Sometimes he works as a street vendor selling in throughout the cantons in his car.

He’s asking for a loan to buy basic grains like corn, beans and coffee, among others.  This investment will help him increase inventory and obtain better profits.

Jose’s dream is to have a better quality of life and to offer his children better schooling opportunities all the way up to graduation from university.
